54 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
20.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 septembre 2021
Overall, Relicta is an enjoyable, if not occasionally frustrating first person physics puzzler that I would recommend if you are a fan of the genre or you like pretending you are Magneto by surfing flying boxes using the power of magnets and levitation.

As a disclaimer: I would recommend anybody who plays to cap their framerates at 60 fps to avoid issues with boxes not flying in the correct trajectories, as 60fps seems to be what the physics were tuned for. This will probably save you hours of frustration, softlocks and restarting if my experience is anything to go by. There are also DX11 and DX12 versions of the game, but I'm unsure if there is a difference to gameplay.

The puzzles are a mixed bag, where the good largely outweighs the bad. There are a lot of clever puzzles in this game that require experimentation and cumulative understanding of the game's physics. Only a few puzzles felt like a breeze to complete first try. The bonus puzzles added after release are even more challenging. This is partly owing to the design but also to the annoying length of some puzzles in the game, especially the last two levels of the main game. The lack of checkpoints in the middle of lengthy, multi-staged puzzles, combined with the occasional instances of softlocking do bring down the enjoyment of otherwise nicely designed sequences. They are still fun to play.

The story is quite prevelent in comparison to other puzzlers in the genre and I found it to be a nice backdrop to the puzzles, the player receiving an update after every puzzle or so. During the second act, the story starts to drag and the characters started to feel less realistic, but it picks up again towards the end and reaches a nice conclusion, depending on your choice. The VA is well done and makes the dialogue feel believable. Some jokes made me chuckle while others made me wince a bit. If you're not into the story, the game wont force you to listen as most of the dialogue and cutscenes are skippable and your enjoyment of the puzzles wont be diminished.

There's a lot of content here to keep your brain ticking and its worth the price, especially if on sale, considering how much time can be sunk into launching boxes and standing on switches. I think this game stands up on its own merits, that being said, there are plenty of other, better, FPP games to whet your apatite if this is your first foray into the genre.

Regardless, I would recommend trying out the demo if you're unsure about picking this up.

TL,DR: Nice puzzles, the narrative is nice and fun, just make sure to cap framrate at 60fps.
 
government mandated bussy
0
29 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
7
Recommandé
18.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 septembre 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

Challenging puzzles and a cool story, but disconnected.

-Overview-
Relicta is a linear, first-person puzzle game similar to Portal and The Turing Test. Both its puzzles and its story are decent, though there is a sense of disconnect between the two. The puzzles are numerous and grow to be quite difficult, which dramatically slows the feeling of progression, and the existence of the puzzles themselves holds a somewhat flimsy connection to the story, making the gameplay feel disconnected from the narrative.

Taking AFK time out of the equation, completion took me 15-16 hours — 6-8 hours longer than I would expect from this type of game.

🎮Relicta can be played with both keyboard/mouse and controller. Both can be re-bound.🎮

-Gameplay-
Basics:
Relicta's gameplay will likely feel familiar to those who have played the aforementioned similar titles; it features a first-person perspective, device for manipulating the environment and objects, and an ever-present A.I. to talk to between puzzles. Players cannot die or suffer ill effects.

Aiming and moving feel smooth and precise, if a little restricted. On occasion, a puzzle segment could be solved or bypassed if the player character were able to simply crouch or climb, which is potentially a bit immersion-breaking.

Puzzles:
The core mechanics are the ability to change the polarity of certain objects to repel or attract each other, and to remove the affect of gravity on cubes, allowing them to fly through the air — sometimes with you riding them. It's a system that often requires players to think several steps in advance, in order to get the cubes and themselves past the myriad of obstacles present. Various new environmental mechanics such as barriers and mobile platforms continue to be introduced right up to the end of the game.
Cube launching time. 
Création de la communauté pour Relicta
Par : Spobbles
Every puzzle in Relicta contains the same features; a barrier blocking progress and buttons that open it. One needs to get cubes on those buttons through a process of gravity manipulation, physics and sheer...

In the latter half of the game, puzzles quickly grow more complex, to the point of being a convoluted mess at first glance. On occasion I found it easiest to find the end goal and work backwards to discover just where I was supposed to start. These puzzles take some time to complete, and often the reward for doing so is a three second walk to another, equally complex cluster of cables, buttons and barriers. This is where my biggest issue with the game begins.

Though I don't mind a challenging puzzle, doing several complex yet very similar ones in a row with little in between begins to feel repetitive and tiring, and made me want to play the game in short burts. Now, that's fine when the game is just a casual puzzle game, but Relicta is a linear story game, and I feel the density of gameplay content halts story progression significantly, as the puzzles contain little relevance to the narrative. For this reason, as well as the complexity of many of the later puzzles, I think the game's pacing and accessibility would be improved greatly by relegating many of the levels (harder ones, especially) to optional content, making the story experience smoother and less repetitive.

World Design:
Set in a near-future sci-fi moon base featuring several distinct biomes, Relicta offers great visual variety. Working in various craters near the base, scientists have created small natural biomes on the moon, including lush jungle, tropical beach, arid desert and more. Though these areas are beautiful and distinct, their differences don't really translate to gameplay. The base itself, which players travel though between puzzle sections, is a great piece of design, with extensive decorative objects and equipment, beautiful natural features blended with the architecture, and a very high level of detail overall. I wish I'd got to spend more time there, interacting with the environment.

-Story-
Relicta's story is told through the eyes of Doctor Angelica Patel, one of a small team of scientists occupying a base on Earth's moon. The base was established by a previous group, and contains a strange alien artefact known as the Relicta. Using scientific knowledge gleaned from this artefact, the past and present scientists have created technology far beyond humanity's current level. An example of this is the gloves that allow Patel to manipulate her environment in the ways described above.
Lore is available in your PDA. 
Création de la communauté pour Relicta
Par : Spobbles
A few collectables are available that offer some insight into the backstory of the locations, characters and game world as a whole. These are located inside the base only, which is a shame.

The existence of the gloves and puzzle tracks designed to test them is briefly explained, but has rather an odd fit with the rest of the story. Every one of the biomes connected to the base features a puzzle track, which is apparently the only way to navigate them, even when there's a vital piece of base infrastructure — such as a generator — at the other end. Invisible barriers also prevent any deviation from the path. Things go very wrong for the protagonist throughout the story, and she constantly needs to be at the other end of a puzzle track. Conveniently, the tracks are all unable to be switched off for some reason or other, forcing her to complete every one in its entirety.

Besides Doctor Patel, Relicta features a few other voiced characters, and I found the voice acting, story telling and characters to be of pretty high quality, barring the protagonist having some dumb moments occasionally. The humour is good, and I enjoyed many of the exchanges later in the game. Relicta manages its time well by focusing its efforts on a small number of characters and relationships. Unfortunately, dialogue would sometimes be cut off by moving into the next area too soon, causing me to stand still and wait to make sure I heard everything, rather than getting started on the next puzzle.

Some of the biomes feature decorative structures or features that cannot be reached due to the invisible walls, but would be ideal places to find collectables. This would also offer a short break and some variety between large puzzles. A missed opportunity, I feel.

-Technical-
This game was played with the following PC specs:
Intel i5-4440 3.10 GHz
16GB DDR3 RAM
GeForce GTX 1650 SUPER 4GB
1680x1050 resolution
HDD
Windows 10
Visuals:
Relicta is a beautiful game with a variety of environments to enjoy, and it comes with a photo mode for great screenshots. 
Une capture d'écran de Relicta
Par : Spobbles

As pretty as the natural environments are, it's the interior of the base I loved the most. The combination of clean, neutral surfaces, vibrant lighting and themed displays such as planters and animated equipment sets a great scene. The game's loading screens feature nice art, too.

Performance:
Using the specs listed above, the game ran at a steady 60fps on max settings. It would occasionally hang for a brief moment, but this was rare enough that it didn't bother me.

Audio:
Relicta features a nice, high quality soundtrack, with quite peaceful, if slightly sombre music. Sound effects are crisp and of high quality, though the lack of footsteps is a little odd. My only real complaint is that the intro movies when starting the game are not affected by the volume sliders, and cannot be skipped to avoid the problem.

Issues:
I did not encounter any issues worth mentioning; the game is well polished.

-Summary-
Relicta is a game with a good story and challenging puzzles, but the two don't interact very well, and it can get quite repetitive. Those who typically have trouble with puzzle games will want to think carefully about this one, or use a guide.

I recommend this game to those who like challenging puzzle gameplay, but warn of its issues and difficulty.

If you're looking for more quality reviews like this, follow our curator page, Devils in the Detail.
 
Spobbles

Really beautiful puzzle game. Puzzles that increase in difficulty as the game progresses and what really amazes is certainly the graphics and the photo mode (not easy to find in an indie game). A sore point is certainly the plot which lacks bite and given that the game is particularly long, it could get boring. All in all the price is adequate considering other games similar to this one. 7/10 my rating.

5.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 juillet 2021
I loved the general concept. The graphics, the dialogue and the slight mystery in the middle of it all. But I think this a perfect example of a game which overstays it's welcome big time. When I got to about half way, I thought I got near the end and some big story moment is coming in. Aaaand then the game just sends me back to solve another bunch of puzzles again and again.

As I've said the concept is interesting, really good in fact, but it has only so much to offer and after about 5 hours the ramp up in difficulty really stalled and I just got more and more tedious levels. Levels where I could kinda see how to solve them right off the bat, but I knew it would take 10-15 minutes to actually execute it properly. Also after a while maps just became all about clustering a lot of things into a single zone or making a single puzzle consist of multiple zones. So again, the difficulty wasn't really solving an interesting puzzle, but trying to see through the mess of options you have in your face.

I's a real shame.

4.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 juin 2021
Um ótimo jogo de puzzles pra qm gosta, lembra levemente o The Turing Test por ser em primeira pessoa e de curta duração (pode ser finalizado em 3-4 horas) com lindos gráficos e várias mecânicas interessantes. Embora tenham vários e vários enigmas diferentes, grande parte deles são baseados em blocos qe devem ser manuseados para desbloquear passagens, porém mta coisa é acrescentada a cada “nível”, incluindo teleportes e efeitos de física e tecnologia bem diversificados e qe possibilitam criar uma gama de desafios únicos. É claro qe se vcê não for mto fã de puzzles não vai gostar de Relicta, afinal ele não tem mta ação e é totalmente focado nos enigmas, tendo também uma história de background qe dá sentido aos cenários e acontecimentos, incrementando toda experiência pra qm tiver interesse.
 
Lady Bloodwell

Non recommandé
11.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 mars 2022
Seemed fine, but gets increasingly more annoying as the game progresses.

This is a puzzle game, there are several principles that you DO NOT break:
1. Dont hide parts of the puzzle. So many times I've found out that HEY THERE WAS A PANEL BEHIND THAT BUT I CANT SEE IT.
2. Dont put mechanics that only serve to screw the player. "Look, there's a corner here with a green screen. Why? To trap your box and force to reset your progress."
3. Make sure your mechanics WORK ALWAYS, not just sometimes.
This game breaks all of them, much to the frustration of the player.

The story is bad, and only serves to make the game longer. The lobby sequences are unnecessarily big and confusing. Something should only serve to take you to the next puzzle is a maze itself, with many long corridors and unnecessary travel sequences.

AVOID
 
MrStratos

Absolutely recommended if you're into games like Portal, Braid or The Witness.

Évaluation publiée le 4 aout 2020
*** Für das (Zwischen-)Fazit ganz nach unten Scrollen ***
(weniger Geblubber mehr harte/ungeschminkte Realität;) )

....


Spaßiges Kniffelspiel für zwischendurch.

Wer Talos mochte oder Portal 2* liebt(e), kann sicher bedenkenlos zugreifen.
Unentschiedenen hilft nur, sich Gamelay Videos auf Youtube anzuschauen, da die Demo nicht mehr verfügbar ist :(, warum auch immer, blöde Idee.

Und wenn es vorkommt das Ihr denkt...Fakk, das muss ein Bug sein**, das geht nicht, lieber nochmal versuchen das (noch bisschen vorhandene ;)) Gehirnschmalz in Wallung zu bringen ;)


* Für mich die Mutter aller Kniffelspiele solcher Art,Wie lang sehne ich mich schon nach einer Fortsetzung
** Zumindest bei meinem jetzigen Spielfortschritt war dies so ... hmm.. geht nicht ..... ♥♥♥♥ Bug....... ..... ...... OOOOHH AAHHHH .... Geht doch .......




---------------------------------------------------------------

So mal ein Nachtrag nach ~10h:

macht immer noch Laune, echt ein schönes Rumgetüftle mit viel um die Ecke denken und mit Höhen und Tiefen:

-manchmal denke ich echt, das kann nicht sein, bin ICH echt zu blöde oder tu ich nur so ?
Dann schaue ich mal auf Youtube, ob einer die Stelle schon gespielt hat und komme zu dem Schluss, ja ich bin so blöde ;)

-In anderen Levels renne ich durch wie nix und Denke, also doch noch Lernfähig ;)


Und nun bin ich in einem Levelbereich angekommen, wo es noch kniffliger wird, wo manchmal nur der Würfel durchkommt, das könnte noch anspruchsvoller werden als bis Dato

-Boah, Nein ich bin nicht Dumm, ich habe nur Pech beim Denken:
Habe gerade, was weiss ich, Ewigkeiten in einem Level verbracht, zig Sachen ausprobiert und dann nach einer gefühlten Ewigkeit fiel es mir wie Schuppen von den Augen wie das zu lösen wäre......
Nenenene, man kann die Dinger nicht bloß "schießen" sondern auch "schubsen", wenn das bei mir in Fleisch und Blut übergegangen ist, dann habe ich sicher den Abspann gesehen LOL
Somit wieder einen Pluspunkt mehr für die Levelvariationen,das man ja nicht einschläft beim rumpuzzeln ;)


-Bin auch einmal gespannt was es mit der Story so auf sich hat,scheinbar wird es langsam interessant/konfus :P.

Alles in allem ist es echt ein (bis Dato) Super gemachtes Knobelspiel und bin gespannt auf die Dinge die da noch kommen werden/sollten/müssten und ohne jede Frage seine 20€ wert :D

Und dafür das ich es nur durch Zufall beim Publishenerevent anhand der Demo entdeckt habe auch eine kleine "Perle 2020" für mich (*ZumEntwicklerRüberschau* *Zwinker* "Wie die Demo ist rausgenommen worden" *Zwinker*)




Beim Abschluss des Spieles gebe ich noch mein Endfazit bekannt.



+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

*** (Zwischen-)Fazit nach 14+ Stunden:***


+ Knifflige Knobelei wo man um die Ecke denken muss

+ "Spannende" Geschichte (denke ich mal, laaaangsaaam wirds Spannend, oder auch nicht)

+ Abwechslungreiche Areale sei es drinnen, draussen, Warm,Kalt.....

+ Die Protagonistin verleitet einen mit Ihren Sprüchen zum Lachen oder zum Lächeln ;)
Dr.Patel ist auf Wildkatze programmiert und ich bin ein Freund dieser Rasse *RRRR* *Miau*

+ Auch nach Stunden Spielzeit (OK IQ-abhängig ;) meine 14h ist bei anderen 3h ;) )
immer noch neues wo die Jungs von Mighty Polygon einem auftischen

+ Für die heutige Zeit und da diese Art von Spielen leider Rar gesäht sind
2 DICKE-FETTE DAUMEN NACH OBEN für diese Perle

+ Wer Talos mochte und Portal 2 schmerzlich vermisst, sieht seine 20€ gut angelegt
(sag ich jetzt einfach mal so ;))



In diesem Sinne,bleibt Gesund und passt auf Euch auf
 
Brummbaer

53 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
2
Non recommandé
3.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 aout 2020
Головоломки – это сложный жанр. В первую очередь потому что очень непросто сделать игру, способную зацепить не только человека, для которого бесконечное решение паззлов один за другим уже само по себе является отличным развлечением и единственным требованием. Дилогия Portal в конце нулевых выступила тому подтверждением, предоставив игрокам не только отличный челлендж в виде головоломок варьирующейся степени сложности, но и захватывающий сюжет, конфликт между персонажами, проработанный лор и юмор, вошедший в золотой фонд цитат на долгие годы вперёд. А затем пошли такие игры, как The Ball, Q.U.B.E., Antichamber, и у них у всех была одна общая проблема – они были уже сами по себе не настолько увлекательными, чтобы предоставить какой-то интересный опыт помимо череды однообразных шарад. The Talos Principle с его размышлениями на тему трансгуманизма и ломанием четвёртой стены выступил более весомо и оригинально, что подтвердила его популярность у большей части сообщества. А что же Relicta, новый представитель жанра из инди-сегмента от студии Mighty Polygon?
Главная героиня – учёный Анжелика Патель, которая работает на лунной научно-исследовательской станции и занимается изучением устройств, способных менять гравитацию и магнитные полярности. Однажды ей звонит её дочь Кира, решившая прилететь и присоединиться к матери в её работе после окончания университета, но уже на подлёте неожиданно происходит некая поломка, система отключается, а коллеги Анжелики оказываются заперты в отдельных исследовательских зонах, поэтому ей срочно приходится двигаться им на помощь и разобраться с произошедшими сбоями. А по пути, соответственно, преодолеть кучу головоломок.
Про сюжет в целом я ничего сказать не могу, потому как не прошёл игру, но с самого начала завязка сама по себе не предлагает ничего особенно удивительного или интригующего. Более того, куцые диалоги разве что дают повод возненавидеть другую женщину-учёного, которая постоянно наезжает на главную героиню (если она на самом деле злодейка, я бы не удивился ни капельки). А бэкграунд самой базы и её обитателей раскрываются в основном через разные записки, разбросанные там и сям, и то ничего занятного, кроме упоминаний клишированных вещей вроде превращения таинственного артефакта (той самой «Реликты») в оружие, в них мне не попадалось. Ещё хуже, что даже при таком скудном сторителлинге игра умудряется ставить галочки насчёт обязательных пунктов по SJW и толерастии. Как говорится, вряд ли кто-то, кого это волнует, поиграет, но мало ли.
Что касается головоломной части – она в общем-то и стала причиной потери всякого моего интереса к игре, потому как потенциально интересные задачки с гравитацией и полярностями были напрочь убиты сразу кучей элементов. Во-первых, все встреченные мной паззлы за три часа игры сводились к одним и тем же перемещениям кубов на кнопки, причём перемещениям долгим, однообразным и унылым. Во-вторых, может, конечно, это я просто тупой, но множество особенностей игровых механик работают крайне странно, а их использованию в игре не обучают вообще никак. Например, расстояние, на котором два куба или куб к источнику поля притягиваются друг к другу, каждый раз просто невозможно определить нормально – то они пролетают мимо друг друга, то слипаются в секунду. В-третьих, окончательно отбивают удовольствие и желание играть множественные условности, на которые, кажется, создатели специально положили болт, чтобы просто испортить игрокам жизнь. КАЖДОМУ кубу нужно ЗАНОВО выставлять полярность и гравитацию после того, как ты просто его ВЗЯЛ. А учитывая, что кубы вам приходится перемещать постоянно, вы будете забывать нажимать каждый раз гравитацию, падать и совершать ещё больше действий. Только не надо искать этому игромеханических оправданий – это просто неудобно, и точка. И конечно, сами по себе кубы физики не имеют, и приседать главная героиня не умеет (а ведь на этом завязаны головоломки!), и вообще, когда игра на загрузочном экране предупреждает, что проседание FPS может вызвать ошибки в физике объектов, хочется только поаплодировать такому вниманию к аудитории.
Визуально игра производит действительно приятное впечатление – Unreal Engine, как-никак. Однако местные красоты и пейзажи уже ничего не значат, когда сталкиваешься с беспощадным и уродливым левел-дизайном. Провалитесь в какую-то трещину или застрянете между камнями – ваши проблемы. И да, если в «Принципе Талоса» вы вдоволь могли побегать по локациям, то здесь невидимые стены и потолки не дадут вам просто шагу ступить в сторону. Серьёзно, в коридорах базы ощущаешь себя просторнее, нежели на поверхности. По поводу саундтрека ничего сказать не могу, я его особо не заметил. А значит, и говорить о нём не стоит.
Ну и что в итоге? Relicta – это ещё одна головоломка, которая вынужденно уйдёт в небытие. Потому как примитивный сюжет, условности уровня 2004 года (и то, тогда уже был Half-Life 2, так что всё ещё печальнее) и душные однообразные головоломки без толики оригинальности уже давно не являются мелочами, на которые можно просто закрыть глаза. Советую пройти мимо, если конечно, вы не заядлый любитель поломать себе мозг. И то, конкурентов у сего «опуса» полно, а достойных тем более.
Оценка: 4 из 10 – плохо (не пройдена).
 
Condor Freedman
552 produits enregistrés
0
27 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante

Non recommandé
11.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 mai 2021
how can this game have such review scores?
+ nice graphics
- wasting your time walking and moving back and forth in bland soulless corridors
- has some bugs like glitching cubes that wont react anymore to your input
- non elegant puzzles that instead of making you feel clever are just easy but long and make you walk a lot with no meaning to it other than to pad gameplay time
- copying other puzzle games elements with no reason without understanding why those elements worked in them
- janky puzzles + sometimes not putting save points that makes you restart the level because of some janky puzzle that gets stuck
- bad choices in telegraphing interactivity and inconsistent meaning for colors
- if you're going to put a story to a puzzle game , at least try harder to give some plausible excuse for why your character keeps solving those puzzles


this is one of the worst puzzle games of that type that I've played , before you waste you're time on it
you should first play games that actually have a soul like:
- portal 1 & 2
- The Talos Principle
- The Witness
- Antichamber
 
cloudante

Recommandé
22.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 novembre 2020
pfffiuuu, just finished the game and man... so many things in mind. First of all great game, so many ideas of puzzle rooms. Might not be recommended for those who are reluctant to mid to hardcore puzzle games.
Now, concerning the mass of puzzle rooms, a certain number are very good and well thought. Others are made complex to look like they are complex just by hiding some perspectives or making some objects not noticeable. To give an example, there is a puzzle room in the jungle where I spent hours either because an object was blocked and I had to reset, or because I did not see an element hidden in the field and I progressed without having this element activated.
Also, the physics of the objects made me solve puzzles in a way that would not, I guess, have been expected by the developers.
Finally, the usage of the 'F' word almost at each sentence (this is how I perceived it at the end). Usually, I do not really care, but when you accomplish a puzzle that took you quite some time, you are satisfied, but the reward from the game is just a discussion between the protagonist mostly based on swear words... you are just in a hurry that they stop talking. The story is interesting, but detaches from all the puzzles. The scenario is just an excuse for making a lot of puzzles, which is fine for me, but there is this little touch that this game lacks from being at the level of a talos or a qube2-dlc. This does not prevent me from recommending this game. I am really addict to this kind of game.

Non recommandé
19.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 mai 2021
This game suffers from several issues that would require massive overhauls to fix. As it is, I definitely don't recommend the game for puzzle fans nor for people looking for a good story. There's none of that here.


Main problem: Artificial difficulty

Puzzles in Relicta are very repetitive. The progression feels incredibly slow due to the fact you're doing the exact same thing for multiple test chambers straight, only in different biomes.

Everything boils down to manipulating cubes to push a distant button that opens a door. It's all you do in the game: grab a cube and gravitize it red/blue/yellow, so it moves where you want it to move. In the latter half of the game a new mechanic appears every 10 levels, but it also involves transporting cubes, just in a different way. Cubes, cubes, cubes. Everything is cubes.

The more you play, the longer the levels become. They're not getting any more difficult, just more tedious due to increased length and complexity. Instead of using the mechanics in a inventive way, the puzzles require more cubes to press more buttons, and the test chambers are visibly split into multiple independent sections. You don't need to think harder, just need to repeat the actions you've already done a dozen times or find out the order by walking around the huge areas over and over.

To further increase the artificial difficulty, the cubes you need to solve the puzzle are sometimes hidden around the test location, so you need to scout the area before attempting to solve it. This is a learned skill in Relicta. If you don't look around first, you'll repeat my mistake of flying on a single cube, wondering what the hell to do, until you notice there's another cube on the other side of a tall structure. Since getting these cubes is trivial, they could just as well be provided from the start without making it so difficult to spot them. What a terrible puzzle design choice.

Finally, the worst thing related to puzzles: You aren't really sure if what you did was correct. You could even be doing the right thing, but due to physics engine tied to framerate, it might not work the first two times and only pass if you try again. You could be surfing a cube across the map and get stuck, because the developers didn't think of this approach. You never know for sure.


Voice acting

The voice acting is equally poor. I don't mind hearing non-native speakers communicate in English, but their dialogues aren't believable; no cutscene evokes any emotion other than pity for the poor actor that had to use an expletive again.

What's more, the characters constantly "interrupt" each other. I'm putting "interrupt" in quotation marks, because what's happening is a character stopping mid-thought, a literal second passing, and another character saying something. This is happening Every. Single. Time.

  • AI: "I advise you to—"
  • One second passes
  • Character: "Shut the f--- up, I don't care."

This feels fake, and since all dialogues are littered with these "interruptions", every cutscene becomes a pathetic exchange of detached sentences instead of a genuine conversation. It breaks all the immersion that the content of the dialogue could have built.


Everything is huge

Every location is either an enormous hub, a long tunnel that's roughly 16 washing machines wide, or an "open" area.

Oh, look, quotation marks again. Why "open" and not open? Because there are invisible walls surrounding most places, and they're placed in such bizzarre spots that it's the funniest part of the game. In one place the character could literally jump down six feet and they could exit the level. But, ha ha! The developers are smart! There's an invisible wall preventing you from doing that. This joins the list of things that prevent Relicta from being believable.

An inviting house on the beach? Can't get there, there's an invisible wall. A fork on the road? Can't go left, there's an invisible wall. A literal wall made of rocks? Yeah, there's an additional invisible wall in front of it, just in case. It's hilarious.


Summary

Absolutely don't waste your time playing Relicta like I did. It doesn't respect your time, doesn't test your wit, and doesn't reward your efforts with a good plot.

Avoid.
 
fri

Recommandé
22.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 aout 2020
非常に丁寧に作られた良作。3Dアクションパズルが好きであれば文句なしにおすすめです。

ジャンルとしては「PORTAL」に近いです。この作品では、ブロックやパネルに「正極」と「負極」を付与できるグローブを使って磁石のようにモノを引き付けたり反発させたりしながら物理パズルを解いていきます。

ユニークなのは、ブロックに対しては上記に加えて「無重力状態」が付与できることです。これを付与した状態で力が加わると、ブロックは滑るように空間を移動します。これを利用することで、ブロックを遠くまで飛ばしたり、天井や壁にあるスイッチを押したり、さらには自分がそれに乗って移動手段にできたりします。やってみると分かりますが、これのお陰でパズルにバラエティが生まれていて面白いです。

非常に嬉しいのは完璧に日本語訳がされていること。ストーリーはほぼ他の登場人物との通信による会話劇で進んでいきますが、翻訳には全く違和感がありません。またゲーム内にあるドキュメント等の文書もきちんと翻訳されています。素晴らしい。

良い点
・磁力をモチーフにしたユニークなゲームシステム
・丁寧なレベルデザイン
・豊富なロケーション
・王道ながら良質なSFストーリー
・完璧な日本語訳

悪い点
・終盤では少々シビアなタイミングが求められる場面がある
・ごく稀にブロックが手の届かないところにスタックすることがある
（いつでもレベルの最初までリセットすることができるため大きな問題にはならないが）
 
bittersweet
0
12 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
37.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 janvier 2022
Recommended with caveats. Relicta is in the same class of physics-puzzlers as Portal, Talos Principal, Antichamber, etc. If you liked any of them, Relicta definitely belongs on your wishlist... but not at the top.

Relicta has a huge number of fun puzzles - it's really good value for money if you're in the mood for them. The problem is that Relicta is really not as polished as the others. The story's sufficiently interesting, but almost all characters are impatient and snarky, making them quite unpleasant to listen to. The hub map is a completely unnecessary sprawling maze full of easy-to-miss collectables that only add frustration to the experience. Many of the puzzles (especially in the DLC) are excessively long, meaning you have to replay a lot every time you ragequit/softlock and have to reset. If I wasn't already hooked on the puzzles, there were many moments where I would have just stopped playing.

So basically, Relicta isn't the game that will get you hooked on this genre, but it's a good hit to feed the addiction. Play the other major physics-puzzler games first.
 
BinarySplit

14 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
5
Recommandé
21.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 octobre 2020
-- Relicta | Deutsche Review --

Zusammenfassung:

Bei Relicta handelt es sich um einen First-Person-Puzzler, welcher trotz wenig variierender Mechaniken durch seine intelligenten Rätsel sowie seine lineare, aber dennoch humorvolle Geschichte überzeugen kann. 9/10 .

Ausführliche Review:

Relicta lässt sich am ehesten mit Portal 2 oder The Talos Principle vergleichen. Fast alle Mechaniken im Spiel beruhen auf Gravitationsmanipulation sowie Magnetismus. Das in der nahen Zukunft angesetzte Setting überzeugt durch eine bilderschöne Grafik und eine durchaus ansprechende Geschichte. Wer ein Open-World Erlebnis oder eine tiefgreifende Geschichte sucht, sollte allerdings seine Finger von Relicta lassen.

>>> Grafik:

Auf meinem PC lief das Spiel auf maximalen Einstellungen in 4k problemlos (allerdings auch kein Referenzwert, da RTX 2080ti & i9 9900k). Laut Diskussionsforen sind niedrigere Framerates durchaus ein Problem, da dadurch die Physikengine ins Stocken gerät.

Die in sehr unterschiedlichen Biomen angesetzten Areale sind gerade für solch einen Indie-Titel einfach umwerfend. Der Mix aus Wüstencanyon, Regenwald und frostigem Schnee (um nur einige Beispiele zu nennen) beeindruckt auf den ersten Blick, was jedes neue Areal auch zu einem echten Hingucker macht. 5/5 .

>>> Leveldesign:

Während das HUB und alle darin enthaltenen Collectibles fast das ganze Spiel über erreichbar sind, werden die einzelnen Areale in linearer Reihenfolge durchlaufen. Das macht storytechnisch Sinn, kann aber für Frust sorgen, da kein Rätsel übersprungen werden kann - auch Hinweise gibt es nicht. Während die Rätsel sehr trivial beginnen, steigt der Schwierigkeitsgrad angenehm an - bei mir persönlich traten kaum Frustmomente auf. Viele spielverändernde Mechaniken werden in Relicta nicht eingeführt, was die Rätsel gegen Ende etwas repetitiv und gestreckt wirken lässt. Dennoch werden wir oft auf unterschiedliche Art und Weise gefordert, es handelt sich bei Relicta definitiv um einen Puzzler und keinen Walking-Sim. 4/5 .

>>> Story:

Ohne zu viel zu verraten: Relicta spielt in der nahen Zukunft, nach dem Ende eines Orbitalkrieges, über den wir mittels Collectables so einiges erfahren können - wenngleich das gänzlich optimal ist und im Spiel keinen sichtlichen Einfluss hat. Viel bedeutender ist da dieses rätselhafte ... Ding, genannt Relicta . Aus Spoilergründen kann ich hier nicht weiter in die Tiefe gehen, das Spiel entwickelt sich aber durchaus interessant und hat einige humorvolle Passagen dabei. Wenngleich das Ende vorhersehbar ist, hat die Geschichte meine niedrigen Erwartungen deutlich übertroffen und mir bei den letzten Rätselpassagen sogar die entscheidende Motivation geliefert, fortzufahren. 4/5 .

>>> Musik:

Die Musik tritt in den Hintergrund. Sie passt, hinterlässt aber keinen bleibenden Eindruck. Einige Höhepunkte werden gut unterstrichen, ansonsten gibt es hier nicht viel zu sagen. 3/5 .

>>> Sonstige Infos & Achievements:

Mein erster Spieldurchlauf von Relicta nahm etwa 12 Stunden in Anspruch - von welchen ich geschätzt 2 auf der Suche nach Collectables, im HUB oder mit der Hintergrundgeschichte der Welt verbracht habe. Ein 2. Spieldurchlauf ist als Achievementjäger dringend notwendig, da das Spiel dafür binnen 6 Stunden durchgespielt werden muss. So bin ich insgesamt auf eine Spielzeit von knapp über 17 Stunden gekommen - Preis / Leistung passt dafür völlig.

>>> Vor- und Nachteile:

+ Wunderschöne Areale
+ Durchaus packende Geschichte mit humorvollen Passagen
+ Anfordernde Rätsel, angenehmer Anstieg im Schwierigkeitsgrad
+ Collectables, welche es einem komplett optional ermöglichen, sich mit der Welt zu beschäftigen

0 Musik sticht nicht besonders hervor

- Nicht überspringbare Puzzles können mangels Hinweisen zu Frust führen
- Wenig Entscheidungsmöglichkeiten; die 2 verschiedenen Enden wären nicht unbedingt notwendig gewesen
- Puzzles werden gegen Ende leicht repetitiv

>>> Fazit:

Relicta ist eines dieser Spiele, von welchen ich viel weniger erwartet habe, als sie mir geliefert haben. Neben der einladenden Grafik haben mich persönlich sowohl die Story als auch die Puzzleelemente begeistert, für 20€ erhält Relicta von mir eine Kaufempfehlung für alle Rätselliebhaber.

9/10
Meine Nominierung zum Spiel des Jahres 2020


Danke für's Lesen meiner Review! Ich freue mich über einen Kommentar, eine andere Meinung oder sonstiges, da ich mir für meine Tests immer viel Zeit lasse. Ich hoffe, ich konnte Dir bei deiner Kaufentscheidung behilflich sein! :)
 
Felix

Recommandé

Évaluation publiée le 8 aout 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

If you liked the review and interested in completion and perfection time of games with additional useful information (for example: how difficult to get all achievements, is MP or DLC required and so on) or interested in reviews like this, then please follow my Average Achievement Hunter curator.

Relicta is a puzzle game and actually the best one I have played since Talos Principle.

Game received for free. Is this a paid review?

My reviews always represent my own opinion. I am not a reviewer / curator who plays/idle each game for 30mins then writes some crap about the game. As you can see from my playtime (and achievements) I finished the game, created videos, guides about the game so I experienced the whole content. Additionally, feel free to check my reviews, I have negatives on “games received for free” if that is what reflects my opinion on that game.

The story

.As usually, I don’t want to reveal too much of the story. You play as a female scientist on a moon base who is trying to find the secrets of an alien object. That object, the Relicta is actually a living entity and slowly infiltrating your mind.

Puzzle variability

Game includes 9 different puzzle areas + the 2 tutorial areas. That means about 50 different puzzle locations without the tutorial levels. Each area includes new mechanics so the game never gets boring, it stays refreshing, interesting and keeps offering new challenges. You also need to be creative, you need to think about all you could do while you use magnetism effect and anti gravitational effect on the cubes. The new tricks are not shown to you in every single area.

Update April/May 2021: Game has now 2 extra story, each with 12, hard levels. These levels very challenging, complex and long, literally doubling the playtime Relicta offers.

Minor problems

The perfect game is not existing. Every single one, even good ones has some minor issues or something we dislike in it. For me these were:

-between puzzle areas you can explore the moonbase. However, these areas feel empty. Yes, there are collectibles for some lore, but still, these areas are a bit boring.
-physics puzzle games will never be perfect. My cube levitates to one direction while it has a zero gravity effect on it, then hits a wall. Shouldn’t it start to levitate to the other direction because of the force it had by the collision to the wall? Well, I believe that would make a game extremely difficult and more random and this is why more logical puzzles, like Talos Principle will stay better, even if just slightly.

Conclusion

Relicta is great. It will train your brain. One of the best puzzle game of 2020 for sure, definitely worth its price. If you love puzzle games then this is a MUST TO PLAY.

Story: 8/10
Replay value: 3/10 You probably won't remember the solution of all puzzles, so perhaps replayable once, but such games usually are not good for replaying. Perhaps after a few years...
Atmosphere: 9/10
Visuals: 9/10 Characters look cute, enemies have some nice graphics too, it is a visually pleasant game. The best part of the game.
Gameplay mechanics: 8/10 Physics based puzzle games always have some minor problems, RNG in executing this, this is not an exception but it is close to perfection.
Music/Sound effects: 9/10
Narration/Voice acting: 10/10 Some say accents on characters are bad. I quite love it actually. It is totally understandable, clear, but also gives some charm to the characters. English became a global language but I believe 80% of humanity, or more speaking it with accent, me included, so negative reviews just because of this is just another clear sign of the anglo-american imperialist suppression.
Game difficulty: 7/10 Some puzzles hard to figure out, but if you like puzzle games then you should be able to figure out each of them. Still stuck somewhere? Then check out my walkthrough where I also explain what I'm doing during puzzles so you can solve it easily. You can find timestamps for the playlist in my steam guide:

Vidéo YouTube™: Relicta Full Walkthrough with fast puzzle solutions and all collectible Part 1/2 
Vues : 28,734

Hey, I am an achievement hunter!

Perfection time: 40-50h+. ~20h first playthrough on main story (without guide, hints, walkthroughs), then +X hours you need to finish the 6h speedrun achievement. It is not that hard actually if you skip cutscenes and you go to the menu at each puzzle start and refresh your memories on that puzzle by checking my walkthrough video. About ~20h more for the 2 extra stroies added to the game during April 2021, less if you follow a video (my guide has vids for these levels too).

There are also collectibles in the game and you need to get them in a single playthrough, all listed with screenshots in my steam guide:

Relicta walkthrough, collectible and achievement guide

Non recommandé
4.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 janvier 2022
So far, the puzzles have been nice but fiddly and somewhat clunky. They may devolve when physics and timing become more of an issue in later puzzles - even in these first couple of hours, I've often had to perform the exact same maneuver several times to get a cube in the right spot due to the fiddly physics. It's been a good challenge nonetheless and I can see the appeal of all the puzzle mechanics.

The things that really broke the game for me were the story, characters, and save system. The main characters are supposed to be mature, high functioning scientists, and yet it seems what they do all day is bicker at each other. The story itself doesn't fit the puzzles at all. You have to undergo urgent rescue missions and whatnot, but you get stuck behind these puzzles for hours at a time and the story essentially has no acknowledgement of the time spent. In terms of the saves - the game only autosaves between puzzles. Sometimes puzzles can take a long time to finish and are essentially segmented into multiple small sections. Due to the physics, sometimes you can accidentally push a cube back into a previous section and have to redo everything. I think the game really needs manual save slots.

I also didn't see the point in all the collectables lying around in the zones in between the puzzle areas - it seems like they were just added because other games have collectables. One of my other complaints is the large size of these in-between zones. If not for the collectables, they could have been shrunk by probably 90% or more.

If you're just looking for a game to scratch that first person puzzler itch, Relicta will probably be a good choice albeit a bit more clunky compared to other titles. For me, at least, the overall cohesion between the puzzles and the story just wasn't there, so I can't recommend it.
 
GAR
10,794 produits enregistrés

Recommandé
20.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 juillet 2022
Si vous avez adoré Portal 2 (mais qui n'a pas aimé ?) et que vous souhaitez retrouver un peu de l'essence de ce chef d'œuvre du jeu vidéo avec ce qui est en définitive un puzzle game solo très sympathique, Relicta est fait pour vous.

Côté audio comme visuel, il n'y a rien de véritablement exceptionnel : les décors sont de temps en temps jolis et quelques musiques sont correctes. Mais l'ambiance comme la qualité des environnements est de toute façon accessoire, car la force du jeu réside avant tout dans l'ingéniosité et le séquençage de ses nombreux niveaux/puzzles.

Encore plus accessoire voire carrément dispensable, et c'est un peu plus embêtant, est l'histoire du jeu. Là où un Portal 2 est délicieusement décalé, Relicta se prend au sérieux et la mayonnaise ne prend pas plus que ça. D'autant qu'on a un petit bout d'histoire après chaque puzzle accompli, ce qui donne une narration maladroite, hachée, car ce rythme n'a pas de véritable cohésion. Et du coup, on fini par zapper assez vite les dialogues et autres interludes qui donnent davantage l'impression de déranger plus qu'autre chose, pour ne se concentrer que sur les puzzles.

D'ailleurs, j'ai senti une correction de trajectoire des développeurs avec l'un des deux DLCs gratuits, celui nommé Ice Queen : certains environnements sont clairement inspirés de Portal 2 et les échanges sont un peu plus ludiques que lors de l'histoire principale... comme une tentative de clin d'œil à son illustre aîné ?
 
Ccf

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
16.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 septembre 2021
I really tried to like this. It's very close to be excellent but they just didn't quite nail the very nebulous "good puzzle design" issue. I think the main problem I had is that the designer(s) treated every new level as building on all previous levels, not just conceptually but also mechanically. Almost every new puzzle mechanic, once introduced, is used in all future puzzles. And the game is long, easily twice as long as it needed to be. As the number of elements in a puzzle space rises, the available interactions go up exponentially. So by the end puzzles are these sprawling spaces with dozens of potential next steps to prune through which makes it feel more like random fumbling a lot of the time, as opposed to the sought after "a ha moment". Add to this that the mechanics are very "fiddly", you're often going to need to launch one cube off another an angle but there nothing in the game which snap it to the right place, you just have to eyeball it. It's very common to have the solution in your head but spend 20 minutes just wrangling the pieces into the right alignment. If they had made each segment about half the length and focused things to build reasoning skills about the game's world rather than just laying mechanics forever I think this could have been a real winner.

All the above is really a shame because the 3D art, lighting effects, sound, etc all completely gorgeous. I see in other reviews that some found the characters annoying and while I can see how they would rub some the wrong way, I really liked them. It felt like a very "real" set of people, more rough edges than sci-fi usually shows (swearing, being sarcastic, having an unpleasant phone call with an ex). The ending is a bit "and then it was over" but it does the job nicely in the context of a Portal-a-like lightweight story.

If you get frustrated part way through (I made it almost exactly halfway and then rage quit on one extra fiddly puzzle I had to completely restart 3 times), there's some excellent YouTube videos of the whole thing you can just blitz through to see the mechanics that get added and watch the ending, it was a much better way for me to experience the game and it might be for you too.
 
coderanger

Recommandé
6.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 mai 2021
果然，解谜游戏的本质就是推箱子。无论箱子是什么形式，推动它用什么手法，解谜的过程，就是把一个箱子推到属于它的洞里的过程。

RELICTA也概莫能外，无论是用磁力还是重力，传送还是抓取，它的最终目的都是把箱子放在充满诱惑力的按钮上，或是搭乘反重力箱子飞到悬崖峭壁旁。没有爱恨情仇，没有魑魅魍魉，不会扣人心弦，也不会起伏跌宕。无论景色如何变化，这里只有孤独的人，不变的按钮和箱。

与之相似的还有另一款解谜游戏《传送门》，可以说作为难得大火的解谜游戏，《传送门》对不少后来者都造成了深远的影响。粗略看来，这两款游戏在设计风格上非常接近，都是从一点核心出发构筑整个解谜环境，同时，也都是严格单解谜题。不得不说，RELICTA做的还是比较成功的。但还有一个很大的不同之处在于，《传送门》中的箱子不只是箱子而已，数量庞杂的机制中，大部分都可以实现场景的向后切换；而RELICTA中绝大部分情况下场景切换都需要通过把箱子从一个地方移动到另一个地方来完成，这使得游戏多少有点单调，但也不是太大的问题。

RELICTA已经达到了它该有的高度，无论是谁来说，也不会认为它是解谜游戏的中低下等。甚至更进一步，它与传送门各有优劣，未尝不可一比。但这款游戏无论是玩家数量还是销量上都非常惨淡，冷门到不能再冷门，怎么想都是发行商的错，发行商出来挨打。

 
胡桃提子
828 produits enregistrés
0
10 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
2.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 janvier 2022

14.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 mai 2021
Достойный наследник The Talos Principle в мире физических пазлов от французской инди-компании...

Relicta представляет собой довольно приличный набор головоломок, основанных на физике, использующих силы гравитации и магнетизма. Терраформированные биомы лунных головоломок разбавлены перемещениями по локациям исследовательской станции в поисках коллекционных предметов, и для отслеживания довольно тривиального сюжета с изучением "злого" артефакта мешающего всем жить. Сюжет подается, в основном, в виде переговоров по рации с еще несколькими персонажами и в виде информационных заметок.

Юмористы французы отгрохали по всей Луне для исследователей, которых можно пересчитать по пальцам одной руки, такие вот интерьеры... 
Une capture d'écran de Relicta
Par : Rrhany


Достоинствами игры безусловно является просто шикарная для игр такого уровня графика, довольно каверзные местами, хорошо проработанные головоломки, наличие бесплатных длц, расширяющих набор головоломок еще больше.
К минусам я бы отнес пустоту и статичность игрового мира, наличие большого количества забагованных ачивок, которые невозможно на данный момент получить, редкое пропадание музыки во время игры (она просто перестает играть до перезагрузки).
Отметил бы еще забагованность некоторых головоломок, но тут меня всегда спасал банальный перезапуск головоломки сначала...
 
Rrhany
6,406 produits enregistrés

16 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
11.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 aout 2020
Beautiful game, interesting world and setting (the story is simple, but it's good enough to carry the main story thread that gets told through dialogue and data collectibles), lots of puzzles to dig into. Dialogue could sometimes be written a bit better but the voice delivery is good.
Production values are great, the world is really well done and each biome feels unique and interesting. The art style is nice and fits the game well, the execution is great. The game also runs really well for how good it looks.

The puzzles are based on interesting fun concepts but start out way too easy (which is fine as an intro/tutorial, but it stays that way for quite a while).
Later instead of increasing the trickiness and difficulty of the solutions and making you think harder the game makes the puzzle areas convoluted and less intuitive instead, which is a shame because the underlying concepts are great.

It shifts the focus from logically thinking about the solution based on what you can see to wandering around in a big messy puzzle area trying (sometimes unpredictable) things until you find the right steps.
Which would be fine if you could just repeatedly try things, but it can get your cube stuck and unretrievable and make you restart the entire puzzle area, including big chunks of the old steps you have already solved, which is quite annoying.
In some cases you can't even try to save it by playing with gravity and polarization (which would actually be fun) because the cube will be stuck behind barriers.

On the bright side the physics are usually quite predictable and you can really focus on what you want to achieve instead of worrying about it glitching out. Thumbs up for that.

In short, the puzzles could (and should) be harder and trickier but more readable and logic focussed which would add more challenge and take away frustration and randomness. It's not too bad and it's still fun to progress and find solutions, but it could be even better.
In all other aspects the game is absolutely great.
 
gabordenes
0
13 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
19.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 juillet 2021
Main Story took me near 17 hours to finish. Unsure if it has also counted the times i had left the game running in the background(Probably). Personally thinking at least several stages took me a while to finish and a few to redo.

Its a First Person Puzzle, the likes of the Witness, Portal and Turing Test. Although it uses some boxes like Talos Principle. I can assure you that it uses different mechanic from all the other games i have played and mentioned. I am also glad it has a story like Turing test.

Most of the puzzles are more like gradual progression per stage. Not like The Witness where you solve one puzzle with nore lation to the next one. When reaching the halfway of the story, there will be longer puzzles per stage and you will take time to understand some puzzles starting point first before proceeding.

There is usually just one way to finish a stage but there are some instances where i solved it skipping a step. Not ideal since i was only making it harder for myself lol. Also leads to a tendency to get stuck resolving it via other ways

Pos
- Decent Story and some lore kinda like Turing Test
- Good use of puzzle mechanics
- Has some VA (but...)

Needs improvement
- There are a lot of F words for some reason. And this is not really normal(or i would think not normal) for scientists

23.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 aout 2021
Play this only if you want a lot of puzzles and don't need a story. Pretty graphics though!

The story segments are way too sparse and too uninteresting to keep playing for them, but if you want to witness the possibly worst death lamentation scene I've ever seen, be my guest.
Put on a podcast or a video instead of listening to the dialogue written with a constant sass level so high that it makes you think you're reading a political twitter thread. Though that feeling suddenly likes to flip-flop, becoming dramatic at times and then venturing into (intended) comedy, which is pretty strange.

The puzzles play well and while they're complex, they're actually pretty straightforward - I didn't have to use a walkthrough a single time which is very uncommon (yeah I'm bad at vidya). And again - there are a lot of puzzles, and there are even more after you finish the game. Probably the best puzzle/price ratio out there.

If you're interested in more story focus (and frankly, a better story) and fewer puzzles, get The Turing Test or The Spectrum Retreat instead. Maybe even QUBE 1 & 2.

11.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 septembre 2021
I wanted to give this game a good go. Even though the characters were irritating. For being mature (at least middle age) scientists/professionals, they sure were catty and hostile toward each other. Very tiresome. The story seemed rather generic but I was curious how it was going to play out.

The world between the puzzles is just too big. Big for the sake of being big. Everything looking alike and very little to indicate what direction you should be going. All so that some collectibles can be scattered around. The lore pieces you pick up could have been interesting. But I found the text in the PDA to be difficult to read and stopped bothering.

But I finally had to stop due to the puzzle game play. Even when performing the puzzles correctly (confirming with YouTube videos), I would run into occasional issues of a box not flying correctly or not being able to jump from the box to the intended landing. Causing me to have to repeat the steps multiple times before I could proceed. The final straw was the end of the Cliff Track. A box kept getting blocked by a green screen. The type of screen the boxes are intended to pass through. Leaving me completely unable to complete the puzzle and proceed.

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
23.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 mai 2023
Schwerer als Raketenwissenschaft

Phsyikpuzzles mit Würfeln…wo habe ich das nur schonmal gesehen…?

Gameplay
“Relicta” ist ein First-Person Rätselsspiel, dass vom Prinzip her viele Spieler direkt an Portal erinnern dürfte. In kleinen Bereichen müssen wir abstrakte Rätsel lösen, die oft mit Würfeln zu tun haben. Allerdings haben wir keine Portalkanone, sondern Gravitationshandschuhe, mit denen wir Würfel und Wandmagneten Rot oder Blau polen dürfen und die Schwerkraft für die Würfel aufheben dürfen. Das Prinzip dürfte klar sein: Pack ich einen roten Würfel in die Nähe eines blauen Magneten, wird dieser an die Plattform gezogen. Packe ich einen blauen Würfel in die Nähe eines blauen Magneten oder eines anderen blauen Würfels, stoßen sich diese voneinander ab. Was sich auf dem Papier einfach anhört, ist im Spiel aber gar nicht so leicht. Die Rätsel sind nämlich teilweise verdammt schwer und knackig, denn auch verschiedene Barrieren, Würfelteleporter und weitere Dinge kommen noch hinzu, die das Spiel echt komplex machen. Manchmal sind die Lösungen alles Andere als offensichtlich, manchmal kann man auch ein wenig “schummeln”. Den Schwierigkeitsgrad würde ich auf jeden Fall als hoch einstufen, manchmal klappt die Lösung aber auch einfach nicht, weil das Spiel nicht immer passgenau funktioniert. Und einen echten Kritkpunkt habe ich: Man kann sich viel zu leicht softlocken und muss das gesamte Rätsel eventuell neustarten. Das hat bei mir dann doch immer wieder mal für einigen Frust gesorgt.

Story
In der Zukunft geht es der Erde nicht mehr so gut und es hat sich eine Art Nation im Orbit und auf dem Mond gebildet. Auf einer abgelegenen und alten Polstation auf dem Mond forschen Protagonistin Angela Patel und ihre Kollegen an verschiedenen Projekten wie etwa den erwähnten Gravitationshandschuhen. Allerdings hat das Team auch etwas gefunden, was nur als “Relicta” bezeichnet wird und von dem kleinem Team geheim gehalten wird. Obendrauf gerät auch noch alles aus dem Ruder und Angelas Tochter muss natürlich gerade zu diesem Zeitpunkt ankommen, um ihrer Mutter bei ihren Forschungen assistieren zu wollen…
Die Geschichte ist alleine wegen der Neugier interessant, was dieses Artefakt ist. Aber auch mit unserer Protagonistin, die ständig mit der KI der Station redet, scheint irgendetwas zu passieren. Es könnte zwar manchmal etwas spannender erzählt werden, aber die Geschichte ist in Ordnung als Entschuldigung für die Rätsellösung. Luft nach oben wäre hier aber trotzdem. Wem eher die knackigen Rätsel interessieren, kann die Geschichte auch ganz gut ignorieren.

Grafik/Sound
Das Spiel ist zwar von einem kleinen Team, aber dass hat keine schlechte Arbeit geleistet. Es ist zwar auch nichts Besonderes, aber die Idee, dass die Forschungssationen verschiedene Biossphären hat, ist schon ganz nett gestaltet.
Die Landschaften sehen schon toll aus 
Une capture d'écran de Relicta
Par : Drake0sugar @ Twitch.tv

Manche Elemente wiederholen sich etwas oft, aber insgesamt ist es durchaus gut gemacht. Der Soundtrack spielt kaum eine Rolle und die rein englischen Synchronsprecher machen überwiegend einen guten Job.

DLCs
Beide DLCs sind direkt enthalten und im Grunde zwei „kurze“ Kampagnen, die nochmal viele knifflige Rätsel mitbringen und jeweils eher wenig Geschichte haben. Insgesamt sind die fast so lang wie das Hauptspiel, bestehen aber aus sehr wenigen Rätseln. Mir waren die einzelnen „Testkammern“ viel zu lang und leider besteht auch wie im Hauptspiel das Problem, dass man sich softlocken kann. Beim zweiten Extra hatte ich dann einfach keine Lust mehr, nachdem mir dies zum wiederholten Mal passiert ist.

Fazit
„Relicta“ ist ein echt schweres Rätselspiel, bei dem die Lösung oft nicht auf der Hand liegt. Ich bin ehrlich: Ich habe öfters mal einen Walktrough angeschaut, weil es manchmal dann doch frustrieren kann. Ich bin doch wirklich nicht auf den Kopf gefallen…oder? Auch wenn man manchmal mogeln und manche Rätsel lösen kann, wie sie vermutlich nicht in der Intention der Entwickler liegen, ist „Relicta“ eines der kniffligsten Rätselspiele, die ich in den letzten Jahren auf meinem Bildschirm hatte. Abzüge gibt es aber, weil die Physik des Spiels nicht optimal ist und grade die Extrakapitel nicht so schön sind. Auch die Geschichte ist leider sehr dünn. Wer abstrakte Rätsel wie auch in Portal mag, wird aber trotzdem seinen Spaß haben, sollte aber gleichzeitig auch vor dem Rätselniveau gewarnt sein!


Weniger rätselhaft, dafür aber voll mit Inhalt ist auch meine Steamgruppe, in der ich meine Reviews veröffentliche. Noch mehr Reviews kannst du zudem in der German Steam Community finden.
 
Un développeur ou une développeuse a répondu à cette évaluation
Drake0sugar @ Twitch.tv
1,512 produits enregistrés

10 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
59.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 novembre 2021
I enjoyed this game. It has its weak spots for sure, but overall I think it's a good first-person puzzler that's worth your time if you enjoy games such as The Talos Principle, Portal, Qube 2, etc.

If I had to describe it all in one word, it'd be... sprawling. The puzzle areas are very large and cover a lot of ground. It can be a little overwhelming at first. I often needed to do a little recon/exploration before I even started solving anything.

The puzzles mainly involve manipulating magnetic blocks, hitting switches, moving platforms around, wrangling forcefields, and taking advantage of various gravity and momentum tricks. You'll need to pay attention to how things are connected via their power cables, as this will outline your prerequisites for toggling stuff.

I thought the level designs were well-suited for the types of mechanics involved, and nothing felt unfair or overly awkward. You can reason your way through most sections by working backwards, so trial-and-error does not play an overly large role unless you're choosing to wing it.

That being said, your FPS setting may impact physics. Like others have suggested, switching to 60 FPS is a good idea. Sometimes things don't behave correctly otherwise, even at 144 FPS.

Visually, I thought the game was very colorful and pleasing to look at. I liked that the biomes all had different climates, which helped add a lot of variety and visual distinction to the puzzle environments.

The two DLC chapters are harder than the main campaign, and they're included for free. However, based on the Steam achievement stats, maybe <= 4% of players even start the DLC - which is unfortunate, as I think those puzzles are a lot stronger in their design. It's a bummer they don't get more visibility.

At the same time, it's understandable. The main campaign is very fatiguing as it is. The glacier stage midway through the game is particularly long and exhausting. I was running on fumes after that one, and yet there were three whole biomes to tackle afterwards.

I think the VAs do a good job with what they are given, but the dialogue itself is often awkward, immature, and cringey. And everyone curses... a lot. The story is neat conceptually, but it seems to have a hard time deciding whether it wants to be serious or silly. It's also supposed to take place in the year 2120... anachronistic internet humor as "new phone who this" doesn't really fit. It would be like developing a game in the year 2000 that takes place in the year 2100 where people are still cracking Whassup jokes or something.

There are in-game collectibles - but none of them are actually found within the puzzle areas, which is a missed opportunity, in my opinion. Instead, the collectibles are often in plain sight, scattered throughout the base station that you return to between biomes. Each collectible gives you some lore that you can read in your PDA, but most of it is pretty meh.

In general, the base station is too large - it's mostly window dressing with lots of cloned assets and nothing to do. It takes a while to navigate, and it becomes tedious with all the maglev schlepping.

Most of the Steam achievements come naturally by completing puzzles and picking up collectibles. Past that, there's a speedrun achievement for the main campaign, which is very generous (6 hours) if you've already played the game once and know what to expect. I went at a leisurely pace, and my second playthrough came in around 3 hours and 40 minutes with plenty of mistakes and a few resets. There's no visible timer in-game as far as I can tell, but you can safely pause or quit if you need to take a break.

In the end, I thought this game was decent -- not bad, not amazing, but somewhere in between. Still quite fun!
 
Eulerian
1,660 produits enregistrés
0

Relicta is a first person puzzle game which, for me, really scratches the Portal itch. You are constantly thinking about where you need to place your boxes and how to traverse the environment. Aside from this the visuals are very enjoyable and the game runs great. The story to this game is a nice addition but nothing special.

Overall the game is enjoyable to play because the puzzels are well thought out and are placed in awesome environments. I reccomend playing this game very much if you like portal and/or the talos principle.

Recommandé
126.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 avril 2021
I find Relicta to be an extremely fine first person puzzle game. It definitely draws from games such as Portal 2, The Talos Principle or Q.U.B.E but has unique puzzle mechanics.

Basically you have to move cubes around and place them on 'buttons' in order to proceed and finish each test. That is done to a great part by using your gloves which can apply a positive or a negative polarity to cubes. Although that sounds very simple there is a vast array of using these manipulations for a certain outcome. What makes Relicta stand out among the multitude of FPP games is that puzzle areas are vast and require a particular understanding of which intermediate goal can be, and has to be, achieved in what order. I thoroughly enjoyed "reading" the environment and making my conclusions as to what I should do next.

As to the visuals, Relicta certainly is a beautiful game but save for regular radio communication you are alone and the lunar station the game plays in feels sort of empty but that is a minor gripe. The voice acting is good but be cautioned that there is a lot of strong language if you are sensitive to that sort of thing.

Lately, two bonus campaigns have been added for free which almost doubles the content of Relicta so it is a definitve recommentation from me. Expecially considering that it is on sale for another two days and costs only 10 €. Go and get it!
 
Innocentive

Non recommandé
9.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 septembre 2020
I wanted to like Relicta. I truly did. I kept playing a little more, thinking "It'll hook me eventually." And it never did, I'm afraid. I went in expecting something similar to Portal... that's what I was hoping for anyways, but I didn't get that. The story didn't intrigue me. There was nothing really piquing my curiosity to push me forward or motivate me to solve the next puzzle. I didn't really feel invested in this character or the world that they were presenting. The "invisible walls" made it feel artificial. The story was not engaging and the puzzles didn't require any sort of creativity. After about the 10 hour mark, I went ahead to and turned it off.

That's not to say that this game is all bad. It has a few positives in its favor. The setting was cool. If you like immersing yourself in science fiction, Relicta certainly delivers that. The gameplay is fair.. there's nothing wrong with it mechanically speaking. The visuals are nice. It just left me wanting something a little more.... engaging.

It wasn't for me, but that's just one guy's opinion.
 
r.doolindalton

Non recommandé
1.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 aout 2020
I would love to give this a thumbs up but can not. I wish Steam would bring back the 5 star system they used to have for games like this. This game fails, but only just and if no one reads this review all they are going to see is a thumbs down.

This game runs beautifully, and the visuals are quite good. The puzzles are challenging without being overly so. The story was decent even if the voice acting was not all that good. Not terrible, but not good either. Where this game fails is the cludgey game play. It's a poorly done platformer, with invisible walls all over the place, the inability to crouch, and jumping not always being allowed. There were many times where I figured out the puzzle almost immediately, but because of the weak controls, simply could not execute. Especially any time were were required to ride a cube. This was extremely annoying. As such I can't give it a thumbs up.
This is fixable with a bit tweaking to the jump and your players ability to stay on a cube they are riding. A bit more traction is needed. I may revisit this title if they update it.

 
Gorankar

Évaluation publiée le 14 décembre 2022
The puzzles themselves were ok, it was sometimes ultra easy and sometimes you didn't realize there was a mag plate somewhere or a box was up on a cliff and when you finally see it you're like ohhhhhhhh there is a pad/box in that spot that i didn't even know existed. Then once you realize there was this item you didn't see you realize the puzzle wasn't hard it just took you forever to see the one item was there.

But i would have just not given an upvote or downvote cause it was a decent puzzle if it was just the gameplay.

But the story was so so so bad. It's like in the distant future the dumbest scientists ever are on the moon working haphazardly, recklessly, and arrogantly with the most advanced freaky alien relic ever. Like imagine the team that developed the nuke but instead they all talked and acted like love island characters. Literally every time the main character talked i got more upset, it just kept building until i was furious and was hoping either the main character actually had no child ever or the child had been dead the whole time. Instead at the end you ditch your ex-husband to run off with the alien relic to go off into deep space with it and your child because... I guess your ex is just that bad? That is literally the end story is your ex is so bad you'd rather just leave humanity to go hang out with an alien that killed your girlfriend accidentally. So after the final cut-scene i was like omg this story is so unbelievably bad i have to go write a negative review just to ♥♥♥♥♥ about this story writing.
 
RequiresAdditionalPylons

9 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
14.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 juin 2021
I enjoy puzzle game so I made it to the end of Relicta but I have nothing good to say about this game, which is disappointing because it looked like it had so much potential. Relicta has so much timing and platforming it is borderline a puzzle platformer which did not play well when it should have just been a puzzle game. By the halfway point the puzzles just get more convoluted and bloated with interference instead of intellectually satisfying to play and beat; after finishing a level I frequently let out a groan for how frustrating it was instead of feeling accomplished. Relicta would have been good if they just made a puzzle game instead of trying to imitate Portal so much, especially when it comes to making "funny" dialogue.

The loud raven caw as the very first sound when opening the game is a rookie mistake... we are about 20 years past when that should have been fixed.

Some say the story is functionable but in my opinion is it actively bad and detracts from the game. The dialogue between all characters bounces between tense+dramatic to flirty+playful even between the main character and the main antagonist. Personal qualm about the story teaser at the start, I hate when media starts off showing an exciting hook and then you play through the exact same sequence later in the game like I've already seen this five minute you showed me earlier, don't make me play it again, just don't do the cheesy *record scratch* "You're probably wondering how I got into this situation, lets start from the beginning"

The interstitials between puzzle zones definitely need a map or waypoint indicators because each time you are dropped in a large facility with no way of knowing where to go and several dead ends, and what you are looking for is a small panel that is not lit up on a console that looks like several others. There is even a PDA that has your current goal that would the the perfect place for a map, but it only has emails and lore documents.... It's so bad that I had to look up a video walkthrough JUST to get to the next area because I was so lost.

A big issue for me personally is the lack of colorblind mode, which is a problem when they have overlapping laser grid walls whose color is supposed to tell you what can and can't pass through, and a switch changes a far away gate from green(?) to red(?) when a colorblind mode could easily put a pattern up to replace the dot pattern on each gate.... The game is full of oversights like this.

My biggest issue overall is that the main challenge of each puzzle is the intentional obfuscation of puzzle elements. The goal to each puzzle does not have any wires or indicator of what button to press to solve it, so all you know is a wall is blocking what could be the exit and something somewhere lets you go past it. On more than half the puzzles in the first zone I did not notice a box in a corner or behind a wall, and there is nothing pointing to it. The puzzles themselves are not that great which might be why they have to pad with the annoying additions of finding the pieces or platforming fillers. In the final zone you have to spot a key part of a puzzle through literal cracks in the floorboards. In that same puzzle trajectory puzzle was done correctly but got stuck on visual shrubbery and makes it seem like the wrong path because of the colored walls. All the stages have too many visual barriers and separated chambers so you can't get a good idea of what there is, leading to much running around just to get a feel of where you are each and every stage. This puzzle design just chains multiple separate puzzles together that could have easily been separate stages but they are mixed together just for the sake of confusion, like having 4 sudoku grids adjacent to each other just to make it seem like a bigger puzzle.

Even early in the game a mechanic has to be used in a non-intuitive way. Several times they introduce a mechanic in one puzzle and the very next puzzle you use it differently. That pacing is just too frantic, at least think of a second puzzle using the mechanics the first way you introduced before forcing a creative and obscured solution. There is just way too much platforming and timing in this game that is intentionally designed for your to fail the first time. The second real puzzle of the whole game relies on timing, by moving your character over pressure plates you aren't looking at and don't snap to, and then grabbing the box in mid air as it flies by or else you have to repeat the process.
There are several more timing ones and even others where you intentionally have to not lock the cube into the pressure plate and leave it floating to line up a shot that might go where you think it should and might not. When new puzzle elements are added there are zero prompts or tutorials on how to use them, which would be fine if the learn-as-you-play style of Baba is You starts you off slow but Relicta just keeps the same cluster of random puzzles and throws in a new one and says have fun figure it out.

The visuals are nice enough I guess, but for a 26GB game it really should look a lot better.. even the moisture pattern on the screen (the character is wearing a helmet?) does not change and there is a big streak slightly above the crosshairs that catches the light and is annoying for the whole game once you notice it.

The cherry on top is how each time you get an achievement you get a second one right after the cutscene. Why doubled up achievements? Really lame and makes no sense.
 
Chadworthy
