Recommandé
11.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 février 2022
Ein Portal-Klon mit etwas Talos Principle. An sich gut gemacht, kommt meine Empfehlung mit ein paar warnenden Hinweisen.

Mein Spielplatz 
Une capture d'écran de Relicta
Par : Keks

Geschichte

Die Geschichte ist eher nebensächlich. Wir befinden uns wohl auf einem terrageformeten Mond (der aber aussieht, als hätte man einen Landschaftpark aus unterschiedlichsten Gegenden der Erde zusammengetragen), irgendwas liegt im argen und wir diskutieren mit einer "freundlichen" KI, während wir Puzzles lösen.

Das klingt nach einem schwachen Abklatsch von Portal und das ist es auch (auch wenn man sich etwas Mühe gegeben hat). An sich nette Dialoge, kommt es nie und nimmer an die amüsante Dramatik von Portal oder an die philosophische Tiefe von Talos heran.

Viele Felder 
Une capture d'écran de Relicta
Par : Keks

Gameplay

Es ist also, wenn man von den sehr langen Laufwegen im Hub absieht, ein reines Rätselspiel, bei dem man Testkammer für Testkammer lösen muss, wie man es vom klassischen Teil von Portal kennt.

Die Level sehen hingegen eher aus wie in Talos. Der Ausgang ist immer eine "Energiewand", deren Sperre aufgehoben wird, indem ein oder mehrere Druckplatten mit einem Würfel beschwert werden.

Wir können diese Kuben mit magnetischen Kräften anziehen, abstoßen und schweben lassen. Die weiteren Funktionalitäten werden Schritt für Schritt meist mit einem einfachen Level eingeführt, so dass diese recht verständlich sind. So gibt es unterschiedlich farbige Energiewände, Schalter, Magnetpunkte und Teleporter.

Soweit ich sehe, gibt es im wesentlichen zwei Meinungen zu den gebotenen Rätseln und irgendwie haben beide recht. Einerseits: Die Rätsel wiederholen sich im wesentlichen, auch wenn sie oft sehr umfangreich sind. Andererseits: Jedes Rätsel ist eine neue Herausforderung, da man sich immer erst orientieren muss und es oft nicht einfach ist zu erkennen, wie was diesmal zu tun ist.

In dieser Mischung kann es auf Dauer anstrengend werden, sich immer wieder hineinzuknien in das nächste Rätsel. Ob es Spaß macht oder nicht hängt wohl davon ab, wie schwer es einem fällt oder wie sehr man das liebt.

Probleme entstehen (und insofern lassen sie indirekt erkennen, wie gut insbesondere Portal entworfen ist), wenn gewisse Abkürzungen möglich sind oder man nicht mehr weiterkommen kann (das Wort softlock habe ich hier gelernt). Das passiert nicht ständig, aber wenn, dann fällt es auf.

Bei den großen Leveln fehlen vielleicht Checkpoints (nach meinem Geschmack), die auch eine Rückmeldung sind, dass man etwas richtig gemacht hat.

Aber das Problem, wo ich scheiterte, war einer der Momente, in denen es auf Timing ankommt, also Schnelligkeit und dabei zielgenaues ausführen hintereinanderliegernder Handlungen. Es kommen Timer und vor allem Wächter, ähnlich wie in Talos, und man muss bestimmte Zeitpunkte abpassen und dann alles richtig machen. Da wird aus einem Denkspiel auch noch ein Geschicklichkeitsspiel. Etwa in der Mitte des Spieles kam ich nicht weiter. Das war m.E. aber auch diesbezüglich die schwerste Stelle, danach konzentriert sich das Gaming wieder auf komplex werdende Knobelaufgaben.

In den Tropen wird gerätselt 
Une capture d'écran de Relicta
Par : Keks

Technik

Die Grafik ist super. Sowohl innen wie außen ist die Umgebung eindrucksvoll. Der Stil eines modernen SciFi-Abenteuers einschließlich passender Schrift ist klasse. Dass es künstliche Wände gibt ist auch gut "erklärt", es wirkt wie unsichtbare Energiewände, die aufleuchten, wenn man sie berührt. Auf Personen hat man verzichtet, man spielt in einer menschenleeren Umgebung in First Person.

Der Sound ist gut. Die Gespräche werden auf Englisch geführt, sind aber nicht wirklich wichtig.

Die Steuerung mit Controller ist gut. Wenn es auf Schnelligkeit un Genauigkeit ankommt, habe ich aber lieber mit Tastatur/Maus gespielt, was ebenfalls gut klappt.

Sonstiges

Ich habe etwa 11h gespielt, bis ich nicht mehr weiter kam (etwa die Hälfte des Spiels).

Die Errungenschaften erfordern neben dem Lösen der Rätsel ein paar optionale Dinge.

In Zahlen für mich persönlich ein Unterhaltungswert von 6/10.

Ein anspruchvoller, evtl. leicht repetitiv anstrengender Portal-Talos-Klon. Mindestens ein Timing-Element war mir allerdings zu schwer.

Empfehlen oder nicht? Ich konnte es nicht durchspielen und es kommt nicht an die großen Vorbilder heran, aber die Rätsel waren interessant bis fordernd, hat also auch Spaß gemacht. Insgesamt also eine Empfehlung mit den genannten Vorbehalten.


Dies ist mein subjektiver Spieleindruck. Für meine Wertung zählt, wie gut es mich unterhalten hat. Entsprechend der Daumen nach oben oder unten, abhängig davon, ob ich es einem ähnlich gesinnten Spieler weiterempfehle. Der Spieleindruck eines anderen Spielers kann aber durchaus stark davon abweichen.
 
Keks
4
7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
21.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 aout 2020
자기력과 중력을 이용한 물리 퍼즐들이 주를 이루는 게임이라고 설명에 써있긴 한데, 실제로는 이것보다 조금 더 복잡하다. 관성이나 운동량도 생각하면서 플레이 해야 한다. 물론 게임이다보니 수식으로 계산을 해야 하고 그럴 정도는 아니다.

퍼즐을 푸는 과정은 탈로스의 법칙과 꽤 유사하다. 구역을 뛰댕기면서 오브젝트를 찾아서 적당한 위치에 두는 식으로 플레이한다.
물리적 트릭을 통해 풀어야 하는 퍼즐이 많고 퍼즐 자체의 난이도들도 꽤 있어서 이런 3d 퍼즐게임들을 좋아했다면 꽤 재밌게 플레이 할 수 있을 것이다. 퍼즐의 갯수도 60여개쯤 되는데, 대신 퍼즐 하나 하나의 길이가 꽤 길어서 플레이타임은 빠르게 푼다면 10~15시간 정도 될 것이다. 한글화도 매우 잘 되어 있어 플레이 하는데 지장이 없을 것이다.

다만, 단점이 좀 많이 보인다.

- 게임이 매우 직선적이다. 특별히 자유도는 존재하지 않고, 미션이 가라는 데가 아니면 갈 수조차 없다. 여기까지면 단점이 아닐 수도 있는데, 심지어 엔딩을 보고 나서도 한번 푼 퍼즐을 다시 풀 수 없다. 세이브 데이터도 하나밖에 지원하지 않는 것 같아서 처음부터 다시 깨야 하는 것 같다... 수집템도 100% 하려면 다시 해야 하는 것 같다.

- 처음부터 난이도가 꽤 있는데, 이 난이도가 처음부터 끝까지 거의 일정하다. 나는 마지막 퍼즐이 풀면서 마지막인지도 몰랐다..
이 점이 위의 직선적이라는 점과 맞물려 게임이 지루하다라는 생각마저 들게 한다. 스테이지가 진행될수록 사용하는 오브젝트의 수만 늘어나고 게임의 난이도 자체는 크게 바뀌지 않는다.

- 이 게임은 퍼즐을 푸는 구역도 엄청 넓고 오브젝트의 종류와 양이 많다. 벽만 해도 사람만 통과할 수 있는 벽, 큐브만 통과할 수 있는 벽, 둘 다 통과할수 없는 벽, 드론만 통과할 수 없는 벽 등 다양하다. 길이만 길고 푸는 방법은 쉬운 퍼즐들도 꽤 많은데, 이런 퍼즐들은 푸는 것 자체보다 지역이 너무 넓고 오브젝트도 너무 많아서 어디부터 풀어야 할 지 모르겠어서 시간이 오래 걸렸다. 이렇게 퍼즐의 규모가 컸어도 앞에서 작동시킨 오브젝트가 뒤에서도 쓰이는 식으로 활용되는 요소가 있다면 오히려 레벨 디자인에 감탄했을 것이다. 하지만, 이 게임은 한번 쓰인 오브젝트가 다시는 안 쓰이는 경우가 너무나도 많았다. 퍼즐 하나를 모두 깨야 자동 저장이 되는 시스템도 이 점 때문에 불편했다.

- 뚜렷한 스토리가 있고 이 스토리라인대로 진행되는데, 스토리가 용두사미로 끝났다는 느낌을 지울 수가 없었다..

- 퍼즐 구역을 이동하기 위해 연구소를 뛰어다니게 되는데, 이 부분에선 뛰어댕기는 거랑 수집품 모으는 거 말곤 할 게 없다. 명색이 연구소인데 사람도 아무도 없고, 딱히 인터렉션을 할 만한 요소도 아무것도 없고 그냥 워킹 시뮬레이션이다. 이 부분은 없어도 게임 진행엔 지장이 없을 정도였다.

- 물리 법칙을 활용하는 게임이다 보니 물리 엔진 관련해서 버그도 있고 버그성 플레이로 넘길 수 있는 곳도 몇 군데 있다. 물론 이건 게임 특성상 어쩔수 없긴 하다.

'퍼즐'로서는 재미있었는데, '퍼즐 게임'으로서는 많이 아쉬웠다. 나는 이 게임이 잘 만든 것도 아니고 못 만든 것도 아닌 중간이라고 생각하지만 스팀에 평가가 추천이랑 비추천 두개밖에 없어서 일단은 추천을 넣었다. 퍼즐 게임을 좋아하고 50% 이상 세일일 때 사는 걸 추천한다.

 
Round Evolution

1
Non recommandé
18.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 décembre 2022
While I do liked the game in the beginning, some time afterwards the riddles start to become very tedious. The just get bigger and bigger. Then you just run around trying things just to find out where you are going.
In the last part, I thought that the puzzles started to deviate sometimes from the logic of the game so far.

The story is not that great, but not a let down. You can give it a go but do not expect a Portal or a The Turing test. As another suggested, it become a chore near the end, and I as well started to play the puzzles in breaks.

A way point would be also appreciated. If you are at the 3rd part of the puzzle and you leave, you go back to the beginning.
 
enigma9
1,207 produits enregistrés
0
10 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2
Recommandé
8.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 aout 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

Après avoir fait réfléchir des nombreux joueurs pendant sa démo. Relicta, le puzzle game développé par Mighty Polygon, et édité par Ravnscourt, est enfin disponible.
Ce jeu d'énigmes basées sur la physique, en utilisant le magnétisme et la gravité, nous envoie sur la base lunaire Chandra, où une équipe de scientifiques explorer les différents écosystèmes à travers des dômes géants. Mais le plus grand secret qui se cache sur cette base, c'est le Relicta. D'ailleurs, on a fait un petit voyage dans le temps, histoire de l’étudier nous aussi. On a écrit quelques notes à son sujet. On a surtout passé des heures à résoudre les nombreuses énigmes du jeu, pour vous offrir ce test.

trailer du jeu

Une histoire de famille.

Relicta est un jeu d'énigmes, où on y contrôle le docteur Angelica Patel, scientifique de génie, travaillant sur la base Chandra. Alors que les recherches sur les différents écosystèmes de cette base se déroulent sans encombre. La base subit des interférences dues à une espèce de météorite aux lueurs violettes, appelée Relicta. Des scientifiques disparaissent, le système se détraque, et la fille du docteur Patel se trouve bloquée sur une autre navette. Seule face à ce danger, Angelica Patel va devoir traverser les différents dômes de cette base, pour sauver sa fille. Mais surtout, découvrir la vérité sur le Relicta.

On pourrait croire que Relicta ne soit qu'un simple jeu d'énigmes. Mais le jeu propose une véritable petite histoire derrière. On ne peut pas vous dévoiler son contenu, car cela pourrait gâcher l’expérience des futurs joueurs, qui souhaiteraient se lancer dans l'aventure. L'aventure se déroule toujours de la même manière, on prend le maglev, espèce de petit tramway spatial, pour rejoindre les différents cratères terraformés de la base. Une fois sur place, on prend un ascenseur qui nous envoie directement dans un gigantesque terrain de jeu. Et on résout les énigmes qui nous font face. Au total, il y a 5 cratères à découvrir dans Relicta.
Et chacun de ces cratères ont entre 2 et 4 lieux à découvrir. Renfermant chacun de nombreuses énigmes.

Pour venir à bout de Relicta, il faudra compter une bonne dizaine d'heures de jeu. Mais cela dépendra de votre façon à comprendre et résoudre les énigmes. Les premières sont assez simples. Mais plus on avance dans l'histoire, plus elles se compliquent. Et parfois, il faudra une bonne dose de persévérance, ou de chance, pour les terminer.

Bleu, Rouge !?
Relicta est facile à prendre en main. Notre personnage est équipé d'une paire de gants qui permet de modifier le magnétisme de cubes et de petites plaques carrées.
Le but dans chacune des énigmes sera de se frayer un chemin, en déverrouillant la porte qui mène à l’énigme suivante, jusqu'à atteindre l'ascenseur final. Chaque cratère apporte sa petite nouveauté, histoire de rendre les énigmes plus complexes.

On démarre doucement avec des casse-tête simples. On va devoir gérer le magnétisme des cubes pour les faire se déplacer. Et ainsi déverrouiller le chemin. Dès le début, le jeu intègre aussi la gravité. Ce qui permet aux cubes de s'envoler. Il est même possible de monter dessus pour atteindre des lieux, grâce à la gravité des cubes. Dans Relicta, le magnétisme est représenté par le bleu et le rouge. Le rouge et le bleu s'attirent. Et les couleurs identiques s'éloignent. Et tout au long de l'aventure, les énigmes se basent sur ce système de magnétisme, qui à la longue, devient simple à maîtriser.

Mais ça serait bien trop simple de ne gérer que le magnétisme des cubes et des plateformes pour progresser dans le jeu. Plus on avance, plus de nouvelles mécaniques s'invitent aux énigmes. Par la suite, on devra aussi gérer d'autres problèmes, comme des portes électromagnétiques qui ne font pas passer les cubes.
Mais qui font passer votre corps. Ou d'autres que ne feront passer ni vous, ni les cubes.
Il y aura aussi des plateformes mouvantes, des interrupteurs, ou encore des abeilles mécaniques, qui désactivent tous le magnétisme dans leur zone de passage. Et tout commence à se mélanger, devenant un casse-tête encore plus difficile à résoudre.

Pour tout vous dire, à partir de la dernière heure de jeu, les énigmes sont tellement complexe, et inclus tellement de mécaniques différentes, qu'on peut passer des heures à essayer de trouver la solution.
Et après de nombreux échecs, on tente des choses, pour que la chance prenne le dessus. Malheureusement, ça ne fonctionne pas toujours. Et on se retrouve bloqué. On n'y comprend plus rien. On se dit qu'on est mauvais. Pas assez intelligent. On se remet vraiment en question. Puis on remarque qu'un petit cube était caché en haut d'une plateforme. Il attendait son moment de gloire.
Et nous, pendant ce temps, on s'acharnait sur des abeilles, qui ne faisaient que leur job.

Car en plus de proposer des casse-tête de plus en plus difficile, Relicta aime cacher les solutions dans les endroits les moins regardés. Histoire de faire comprendre aux joueurs qu'il faut aussi fouiller un peu partout.

D'ailleurs, entre chaque zone d’énigmes, on retourne pendant un petit temps dans la base.
Et quand on fouille dans les moindres recoins de cette base, on y découvrir des objets qui vont servir de collectibles. Cartes de données. Documents. Ou objets en tous genres. Il y a de nombreux petits collectibles à récupérer. Mais uniquement dans la base lunaire. Histoire de prendre une pause bien méritée, après des heures dans un cratère.

Un voyage à travers des dômes.

Notre voyage dans Relicta est peut-être semé d’embûche. Mais il reste inoubliable. Surtout grâce à sa magnifique direction artistique, qui nous fait découvrir 5 écosystèmes totalement différents.
Et tellement magnifique. On parcourt des plaines enneigées. Des canyons arides. Des montagnes parsemées d'arbres. Ou encore, une sublime île tropicale. Et tout ceci, en restant dans une seule et même base. On est totalement dépaysé par les différentes zones que propose Relicta. Et surtout, on en prend plein la vue.
Déjà que le jeu est magnifique. Tous ces lieux immenses et très détaillés, le rendent encore plus beau. Lors de la démo, on avait déjà découvert la beauté de Relicta. Mais ce n’était qu'une infime partie de ce que nous réservait le jeu.

Au début, on s'attendait à découvrir un nouveau Q.U.B.E, qui reprend un peu le même style d'énigmes.
Mais on ne pensait pas que le jeu serait aussi poussé, et magnifique. Même si les casse-tête ont le don de nous faire bouillir les méninges, l'univers nous offre quelque chose d'apaisant, qui permet de détendre un peu, en observant les magnifiques paysages du jeu. Si vous aimez les points de vue exceptionnels. Relicta vous en offre à foison. Parfois, juste pour le plaisir, on se pose, et on prend des photos de l'environnement.
D'ailleurs, il y a même un mode photo intégré, pour se faire un petit plaisir supplémentaire.

.... La suite sur Couple of Gamer via le lien ci-dessous

Plus d'avis sur les jeux: Couple of Gamer

Évaluation publiée le 10 mai 2021
地图设计太烂，尤其在基地里，根本不知道要去哪，难不成找路也是解密的一部分？？？？？？？？从一个基地晃悠半天去到另一个基地，然后发现走错了，然后再返回来接着找，这种类型游戏搞什么沙盒？？？？？？？？？设计者有病吧非要加个基地场景？？然后任务标识也没有，很多游戏销量差是有原因的，设计者总喜欢加些反人类的东西当作创新。还有这个游戏没有手动保存功能，后面的关卡，一个谜题很大，如果没有解完退出下次还要重新玩，恶心至极！

Non recommandé
8.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 octobre 2021
先说解密，解密还行，难度适中，也没有什么眼前一亮的设计，比较一般。
然后我就要吐槽的就是解密之外的地图设计了，真的蠢，整得还挺大，完全没用，也没个指引，跑来跑去的费了一大堆时间去找地方。你告诉我要去梅苏克（好像是），但是我在中央基地上的地图看也没看到哪个地的英文名读着像的啊，有好些房间和柜子能打开的打开里边也啥都没有，我直接喵喵喵？？？。我是来玩解密游戏的，不是来浪费时间的。
 
黑夜的黎明
378 produits enregistrés
0
11 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
20.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 aout 2020
Se trata de un juego de puzzles donde deberemos combinar el magnetismo, la gravedad y la polaridad de los campos para completar los puzzles que conforman las distintas fases. Cómo se puede observar, el juego bebe de juegos de puzzles como Qube, Portal o The Talos Principle. No sólo sirven de inspiración para el tratamiento de los puzzles, sino para contar una historia.

En un principio, los puzzles serán simples, mover cubos y activar interruptores. Pero conforme avanzamos en el juego, se irán añadiendo nuevas mecánicas y formas de completar los puzzles. Esto hace que la premisa de gravedad, magnetismo y polaridad se vuelva más creativa y nos encontremos volando en un cubo mientras vamos activando campos magnéticos o pulsando pistones, mientras esquivamos robots que nos desactivan la polaridad, para llevar un cubo a través de un mapa hasta su correspondiente botón.

La dificultad del título no es excesiva, por lo que el progreso de aprendizaje es correcto, aunque si me he encontrado algunos picos dispares de dificultad, donde en una sala el puzzle es muy sencillo y en la siguiente de repente escala bastante su dificultad. Pero no es la tónica habitual.

Cómo menciono en el primer párrafo, el juego también se inspira en Portal en la forma en la que trata la historia. Aunque no lo realiza de la forma excelente cómo lo hace el título de Valve, las conversaciones entre los personajes son muy divertidas, especialmente ♥♥♥ un personaje que nos recordará a aquellas divertidas conversaciones ♥♥♥ GladOs, y sirven para relajar al jugador tras una sesión de puzzles.
Además podremos encontrar distintos coleccionables en forma de documentos que encontraremos por la base lunar mientras vamos de una zona a otra y que podremos consultar en una PDA, que nos enseñarán más cosas del mundo en el que se ambienta Relicta, que es muy interesante. Es de agradecer el esfuerzo en crear una historia en este género, donde no se suele dar mucho.

En cuanto al apartado gráfico, el juego es muy bonito. Nos hará recorrer bonitos parajes ambientados en distintos biomas desde una tundra a un desierto. Este último en especial me ha gustado mucho.

Si hablamos de duración, creo que al juego le sobran unas 3-4 horas. Aunque la realización de puzzles es divertida, llegado a un momento de la historia se siente cómo que el juego se alarga un poco de forma artificial, forzándonos a volver a todos los biomas para volver a realizar más puzzles. A mi me ha durado unas 20 horas y quizás hubiera preferido unas 12-15, en mi opinión.

Cómo otra pega, en algunos puzzles me he sentido que no estaba haciendo lo correcto y los he completado sin saber muy bien cómo al salir volando ♥♥♥ un cubo y acabar en la parte final del puzzle pensando que me he saltado pasos, aunque esta sensación no es muy común, la habré sentido en 3-4 ocasiones.

En general, el juego me ha gustado mucho. He disfrutado mucho los puzzles y me ha sorprendido la historia, que suele ser banal en este género y me ha parecido divertida y atractiva. Güen trabajo, Mighty Polygon.
 
Navarro

Non recommandé
4.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 juin 2023
"It's so dense. Every single [puzzle] has so many things going on." - Rick McCallum

The story is phenomenal (so far). The voice acting is great. The writing is pretty funny, I'm very happy that a puzzle game let the scientists say "♥♥♥♥". The environments are beautiful. The puzzles start out pretty neato. Then they stop being pretty neato.

The puzzles at the beginning of the game are fairly simple and do a good job of conveying puzzle mechanics. Then as puzzle games do, the complexity ramps up. What usually happens is that later puzzles combine concepts in new and interesting ways, and every so often add a new mechanic to permute with all the other things that the player has seen so far. The design of Relicta makes this ramping complexity extremely tedious. I got so fed up with the puzzles that I looked up a complete play-through on YouTube to see how long the game takes. The play-through was 16 hours. Time-wise, I'm only a quarter done with this game, and I'm rapidly approaching the point where I don't want to keep playing.

In the later levels that happen about one-third of the way through the game, I go to a new room and am overwhelmed by the number of moving parts. I stare at it for 5 minutes, then make one move and get some progress. Then I stare at it for another 10 minutes, and make a second move that gets even more progress. Then I stare at it for 15 more minutes until I solve it. I'm looking at 15-20 different features of the puzzle map and trying to figure out how they can all relate together, or whether they're even related to each other.

The complexity of all these puzzles would be fine if the process weren't so draining. There's a visual overload that saps my energy as I stare at a physics puzzle and try to figure out how on Terra (to reiterate: story good!) I'm supposed to proceed. Then when I figure it out, I don't get a sense of euphoria at finding a new mechanic. I feel like a third grader learning how to open dial locks for the first time, helplessly toying with the lock on my locker, and feeling a sense of relief when it opens that I don't need to deal with the lock anymore. Rarely in this game do I look back at a puzzle I just did and say "Wow, that was cool!" Instead I remember that the play-through is 16 whole hours and I need to get a move-on if I want to finish the game and spend my time on other things.

I think if the game were somehow shorter, then I would be more amenable to playing through the whole thing. The plot points should absolutely stay the way they are, but maybe the number of puzzles within each region could be cut down. A lot of energy is required to progress the game to the next major plot point, and I'm busy enough otherwise that I don't have that energy.
 
Un développeur ou une développeuse a répondu à cette évaluation
1=2
0

Évaluation publiée le 13 juin 2021
It's like Portal, except instead of portals, you push blocks.

It's like The Talos Principle, except instead of philosophical commentary, it's pointless melodramatic dialogue where the "writers" think the height of humor is saying ♥♥♥♥.

Puzzles start out okay, although not particularly well designed, as you figure out all the gimmicks of the main mechanic. As you can imagine, there are only so many ways to push and pull "magnetic" boxes, and it quickly devolves into long, convoluted puzzles that feel like busy work.

Honestly I probably would have just uninstalled and not a left a review, but the dialogue made me want to blow my brains out.

Évaluation publiée le 25 janvier 2022
I can't recommend this game and I made it pretty damn far (only had two more sections of the game to complete) but this ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ game is just way too much of a slog. It has some great satisfying puzzles coupled with some stupid boring puzzles. The puzzles in this game also suffer from “Did I do that right?” almost 40-50 percent of the puzzles I completed without using the tools that were obviously put in place to use. On more then one occasion I skipped entire sections of a puzzle segment because I had a “lucky” spin or toss on a block or solved it a different way. It completely feels like you (the player) are breaking the rules of the puzzles but NOT in a good way because you then take those techniques, that you should not be doing, and try to use them in another puzzle segment and it completely throws the flow of the game off. Not only that I had multiple instances of the blocks getting STUCK in the level and there being no way out without resetting the segment, while this may not seem like a big deal the later segments in the game are much longer so a block may get stuck in an unrecoverable area and you are forced to reset THE ENTIRE ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ SEGMENT, this is what put me over the edge in the Forest River area and caused me to quit. The story is also very meh…
Pass on this one, even for free.

Go play Talos, Qube series or the Portal series instead.

Produit reçu gratuitement

This game was gifted to me! The concept is great. It reminded me of Portal, but it should NOT be compared to it.

It just didn't quite hit the spot and the story did get a little confusing in some parts, especially when it would get you worked up for a story arc end or turn and then.... it was just more puzzles. There's bugs that need to be worked out, load times were long, and it just didn't run very smoothing no matter how I adjusted the settings. Puzzle difficulties were inconsistent. Sometimes I got threw in under ten minutes, other times it took me longer. With and without tutorials.

Don't really recommend this game overall.

Non recommandé
3.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 mars 2022
Puzzle gameplay and graphics are the highlight, though gameplay stops evolving and becomes repetitive around the mid-point. Plot and conversations are embarrassing. Buy maybe if you're a puzzle fanatic and on heavy sale only.

As far as qube-puzzle-games are concerned, this one quickly becomes challenging, even if you're quite familiar with said games (though not as hardcore as DLC for QUBE2).
The only thing that feels off is that you can't throw qubes or drop them while jumping, which is a strange limitation. This first impression lasts a couple hours before stagnating, which makes the game really worth around 2-3 bucks.

Visuals look great and it runs well even on my potato PC with graphics settings: highest-mid-low-highest-highest-mid-highest (then resolution scale adjustment to get max fps)

gfx settings are bugged and don't always apply, or sometimes reset. Changing them should be done in the start menu of the game and not while playing.

Plot is meh. There's some illogical nonsense to make it seem like solving these puzzles is sth important and heavy suspense of disbelief is required, but usually it's not too distracting.

The most annoying thing is the voice acting. It's obviously a small budget game. But then it just should be less of it. It seems like one single voice actress recorded the lines for almost all characters, with slightly varying pitch and accents. Overuses "f.uck", to seem cool or edgy, but most of the time it's out of place. The humor is corny and unimaginative.
There's a ideological propaganda red-flag with them calling themselves "women of science" instead of "scientists". There's enough SJ-filth in games as it is...
All of these characters don't sound like scientists in space. Too much swag, too cool, too unrestrained, too confident, too extraverted. They seem more like at a college party than on the moon.

Recommandé
1.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 mai 2021
This game is currently in the Humble Bundle for May 2021. If you are interested in the game and it's before June 1st, 2021, consider picking up the game as part of the current monthly bundle.

This is a first-person physics-based puzzler, which means it’s like Portal or Talos Principle, though this time around, the big gimmick is the ability to enable or disable gravity for the blocks as well as magnetize them.

There’s also a story that Relicta keeps trying to make the player care about. The concept is fine, but I found myself tuning out after the first hour, I didn’t care about any of the characters, and a few of them felt like they were having vicious mood swings in between each line. Relicta could have been better off just focusing on the levels which were well designed.

The puzzles in Relicta are rather solid, and after the first couple of sets, they started to introduce interesting and unique concepts that kept me having to understand the rules for the world.

Pick this up if you enjoy block puzzle games, though I would say this isn’t as well done as either Talos Principle or Portal. If you don’t like puzzle games, there’s not much here for you.

If you enjoyed this review or want to know what I think of other games in the bundle, check out the full review on or subscribe to my youtube channel:

Vidéo YouTube™: Humble Choice May 2021 Review - Getting Metro Exodus at a steal. 
Vues : 2,058
It's another month, and another Humble Choice, so let's take a look at the games and see what we'll find for the Humble Choice May 2021.
 
King Link

4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
32.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 aout 2021
In my opinion a very enjoyable, challenging and atmospheric puzzle game with nice story integration.
All in all the main game (without DLCs) took me about 33 hours to play through without walkthrough, where I enjoyed almost every minute of it. The game also has it's not so good sides indeed, but 90% of the game I really found joyful.

So on the good side:
+ Great graphics
+ Challenging puzzles, but fair and always able to find a way out with logic or "creative" thinking
+ Well I would say "nice" story integration, while not perfect and not always logic, it still gives you a part of the game's atmosphere
+ Great atmosphere
+ The chance for a "dead-lock" situation is very low
+ nice sound effects

The neutral side:
o There is some music, but I would not really call it music. But it's okay
o Indeed there is much profanity in this game, but that's part of the protagonist's personality, so for me it's okay :)

The negative side:
- There are some few situations where, with bad luck, you really can stuck and have to restart the level
- Checkpoint saving ... I personally really did not like that, because it means you have to complete a puzzle before you can save the game .. which in later levels can take more than an hour.. Most time it's not a big loss, as, if you already know how to solve the puzzles, you can usually redo the steps in about 5 minutes, but there are also some puzzle elements which needs accurate moving and/or timing, where it's really annoying if you can not save and have to redo it, if you need to quit the game..

But all in all I would buy this game again and I even rebought this game for the full price to support the, in my opinion, developer's great work. Thanks for given us that game. Perfect for people seeking out for more after Talos Principle or Portal :) It's not the same .. sure! .. it's not that perfect .. also sure! .. but it's still totally worth buying and playing :)

Évaluation publiée le 10 juillet 2021
Attenzione: potrebbe contenere spoiler (se il gioco avesse una trama).
Nelle puntate precedenti: abbiamo la dottoressa Angelica Patel, mamma di Kira e ex moglie di un certo Ragnar Nguien. Perchè in Relicta è tutto rose e fiori: i personaggi hanno nomi e cognomi ♥♥♥ latitudini incompatibili, la nave si chiama Solidaridad, perchè War of Destruction whit Blood and Proud Cazzi e Mazzi nel 2021 non è accettabile che siamo tutti corretti e il computer di bordo si chiama Sys anche se ha una voce da uomo perchè sempre nel 2021 i pronomi sono sostiuiti da un * e Bro non è femminista. Relicta poi ci insegna ad amare il prossimo, perchè diverso non è male ma arricchimento. Quindi quando la nostra Angie Patel fa amicizia ♥♥♥ il suo ospite parassita, mi chiedo perchè ho sverminato i gatti. A suo favore possiamo dire che meglio l'infezione del marito finno/congolese. Il gioco deve essere ambientato davvero in bel mondo, non vedo l'ora di visitare New Samarcanda!

Pro: i puzzle sono fantasiosi e ti obbligano a cercare soluzioni poco consone e sensate. La progressione della difficoltà ben calibrata.
Tecnicamente ineccepibile e ben ottimizzato.

Contro: troppo lungo, diventa sfiancante.
Trama senza ne capo ne coda.
Non c' è una vera colonna sonora e si sente la mancanza.
I muri invisibili nei livelli sono una cosa che dovrebbe essere vietata dai trattati internazionali.
Doppiaggio osceno.

Epico finale alla Mass Effect 3 ♥♥♥ morto che muove la mano. Epico davvero.
Se mi faccio un altro gatto lo chiamo Solidaridad, che ♥♥♥ Miranda e Talos ci sta bene come Ragnar ♥♥♥ Nguien.

Évaluation publiée le 7 octobre 2020
F*#ck you, Patel... this was a damn good game!

Ich habe es sehr gemocht und unglaublichen Spaß an den Physikrätseln gehabt.

- Ja, die Story ist etwas mäh... aber das ganze Ding schreit förmlich nach einem besseren zweiten Teil (siehe Portal)

- Die fast unsichtbaren Biom-Begrenzungen haben mich überhaupt nicht gestört. Was soll ich in einem Rätsel-Spiel rumlaufen wie in einem Open-World-Game? Wird ja schließlich auch in den Emails erklärt, dass es sich um abgetrennte Biome handelt.

- Die Grafik ist wirklich atemberaubend. Insgesamt habe ich die Atmosphäre in diesem Spiel sehr genossen. Die Sounds passen wunderbar. Die visuellen und auditiven Anleihen an Portal und System Shock 2 habe ich geliebt

- Einige Rätsel habe ich definitiv per Zufall beim Rumprobieren ohne Plan gelöst, einige Rätsel fand ich bis zur Unfairness unübersichtlich. Im Großen und Ganzen waren aber alle Rätsel lösbar. Und ich habe es geliebt, wenn das Game mich dazu gebracht hat, Out-of-the-Box zu denken

Wer Portal und ähnliche Spiele liebt, wird auch dieses Spiel mögen.
Ich hoffe, es gibt irgendwann einen zweiten Teil... ich werde diese gravitierenden Magnetwürfel, diese kleinen fiesen, und dann doch so nützlichen Drohnen... und die Saugroboter ;-) echt vermissen

 
Mo Elfenwinter
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
12.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 juin 2021
I will not be comparing this game to Portal. It has not only been years since I've played that game, but many other reviews have already gone into depth with their comparisons between Relicta and Portal. I also believe it's better to judge a game focusing more on its individual qualities.
I have also not completed this game for reasons I will specify in this review.

tldr: Buy it only for the gameplay. The first 10 hours are excellent. If you get any more mileage out this game, I commend you.

Story
You control a scientist who loves spouting witty dialogue, whether it be to her daughter, her ex-husband, her colleagues, or the AI controlling the station. The voice acting is pretty good and it was interesting to hear english-speaking Indian voice actors. The plot itself is alright, but there's a pretty weak justification for the player to be doing all of these puzzles. You wouldn't want to play this game for the story.

Gameplay
Solving puzzles with gravitation and magnetic powers sounded daunting at first, but the first few hours did a really good job teaching the player how to use both of these mechanics.

Over the course of the game, you are also introduced to new obstacles that you must learn to circumvent. These range from color-coded barriers that prevent the player and/or blocks from passing through, switches that are powered from manual activation or pressure plates, and platforms with their own magnetism or movement properties.

One irritating note is that the game tries really hard to make sure that the puzzles are done in the most linear way possible. On every level, there are invisible ceilings and invisible walls. If you jump while sprinting, your jump will only go a fraction as high. You can only pick up blocks while you are on the ground. Ironically, I found completing the puzzles in unintended ways to be a much more fun approach, especially in mid-late game levels where numerous obstacles are stacked on top of each other and can take quite a long time to complete in the intended way. It was at this point in the game that I stopped having fun and I felt like I was doing work to complete each level. I no longer felt joy from thinking about what was coming next and instead every level was just one step closer to finishing the game. As such, I have yet to finish the game and I do not feel any motivation to continue.

Visuals
Relicta takes place over many different locations but absolutely none of them have any discernible effect on the puzzles. You also cannot interact with the environments in any way. The game runs at high graphics settings on my GTX 1650 at a solid 60 fps, but my GPU reaches temperatures around 75-78 Fahrenheit. This is surprising, considering that I am able to run games I would expect to be more graphically intensive at similar frame rate but much lower temperatures. I believe this game is not particularly well-optimized, but it's not a huge issue if you settle for medium/low graphics.

So why am I still recommending this game?
Because I can tell that the developers put a lot of work into the quality of this game. It has several shortcomings, but I am not in the slightest disappointed with the first 10 hours of my experience with the game. I believe if you get this on sale or in a bundle, it's worth playing to see if you might enjoy playing this game after the 10 hour mark.
 
Knice
318 produits enregistrés
0
13 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
5.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 aout 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

Like this Review? Follow The Cpt Froggy Club Curator Page for plenty more!

Upon loading the game you’ll be given the choice of playing the game in either DirectX 11 or DirectX 12. I never tried playing in DirectX 11 only in DirectX 12 and the game played fine. The game starts with Systems (AI) declaring a “Security Breach. This is not a drill. Initiating containment sequences...” The containment field in the Relicta chamber is collapsing, Doctor Laia Alami screams at Doctor Angelica Patel (you) not to approach the Relicta chamber! Ignoring her. Doctor Patel goes for a manual shutdown of the systems while Doctor Alami tries to override you and lock down the sector with Systems.

While this is happening, there’s a critical containment failure, in the Relicta chamber. Systems identifies an Unidentified Malicious Vector, Emergency Lockdown is initiated, Core Systems have been compromised. Shutdown is in progress, as Doctor Alami politely screams for the override to prevent Doctor Patel from shutting down the system. It then goes dark and the story continues from an earlier point in time, 2118, two years earlier in the De Gerlache dome. The Der Gerlache dome is one of several terraformed biomes at the Chandra Base on the moon.

You enter the dome it looks just like it would on Earth, multicoloured leaves adorn the trees, green grass and blue skies. You are testing the Gravitonic Wearable Interface (gloves) which you will use to move and manipulate cubes so that they can be placed on pressure pads. Upon placing the cubes on the pressure pads they will open forcefield gates. Sometimes you’ll have to place cubes on multiple pressure pads before a gate is opened. You can walk through some gates but not with carrying a cube.

Each cube has Positive and Negative Magnetism which are controlled by your left and right mouse button. So, that when you have two cubes that are the same colour they will have negative magnetism and will push away from each other, while two different colours will attract to each other. Turning the gravity on and off with the middle mouse button will then allow the cubes to float. Using the positive and negative magnetism will allow you to send your cubes further distances, pull them closer to where they are required or send them higher above the ground.

You will also come across plates on the floor and walls and you’ll be able to change the magnetism to the same or opposite of the cubes. This will then allow you to send your cubes along a pathway to where they need to be. There are also some stations where you can place certain cubes and teleport it to another station. There are different types of stations each have a symbol to distinguish which cubes go where. You can then teleport the cubes to other areas that have a station behind a forcefield.

There are multiple puzzle areas for each biome region you visit and after completing an area you’ll head back to Chandra Base. Upon returning to base the story will reveal its self some more and giving you some information on what is happening and what your next move will be. Also scattered around are collectable items to find and documents which will give you some information on what is going on at the Chandra Base.

In the Options there’s settings for Graphics (Resolution, Window Mode, Show FPS, FPS Limit, Render Scale, General Quality, Vegetation, Post Processing, Shadow Quality, Texture Quality, View Distance, Visual Effects, Antialiasing and V-Sync). Audio (Master, Music, Sound Effects and Voice Volume Sliders). Controls/Accessibility (Mouse Sensitivity X + Y, Controller Sensitivity X + Y, Invert Y Axis, View Bobbing, Motion Blur Crosshair Type). Languages (English, Spanish, French, Italian, German, Russian, Polish, Brazilian Portuguese and Chinese), Gamma, Key Binding and Tobi Eye Tracking.

Relicta is a great looking first-person physics-based puzzle game that takes place in terraformed biomes on the moon. The puzzles can be challenging but with a bit of thought you’ll figure them out. There is some “French” language in the game which doesn’t bother me at all but it may offend some folks. I’ve had one problem while playing and I got stuck between a cube station and a wall after jumping around. However, a quick reboot and it was back to normal and haven’t had any other problems so far.

Positives
+ Looks great
+ Challenging puzzles
+ Decent story
+ Has achievements

Negatives
- Can be frustrating at times
- No cards currently

Combine magnetism and gravity to complete puzzles in biomes on the moon in this first-person physics-based game.

7/10

Key provided by developer/publisher for review purposes via THE CPT FROGGY CLUB!

Any opinions expressed are entirely my own!

For more reviews, great game giveaways and much more.

Jogo similar ao The Turing Test, com um gráfico bom jogabilidade simples e uma temática boa, em que se movimenta caixas magnetizando-as de forma a repeli-las ou atrai-las, a dificuldade do jogo está relacionada a sua capacidade de resolver problemas lógicos !

Recommandé
58.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 novembre 2020
IF you like solving puzzles...Get this game!
You can immediately tell that The Developers have spend a lot of time and work to get this game to this level of perfection.
The environment and graphics look great, play is smooth without any glitches or bugs, and the puzzles are wonderful (Some are very hard and some are very easy and the rest fall somewhere in-between)...BUT they are all fair and logical.
My Main Gripe with the game is the SAVE Game Feature.<<<The Game Saves Itself When It Wants To. You have No Control on when to save your progress.
Example: You may have worked on a puzzle for over an hour, made great progress on getting through it but you have to quit the game for whatever reason. The next time that you start, you will be BACK at the beginning of the puzzle and not where you left off when you quit and that is VERY Frustrating.{But don't let that stop you from experiencing this game.
My only little nit-pic is: Between the puzzles, you have to go through this needless array of rooms, trams, etc. that, to me, was just a confusing waste of time and it felt disjointed from the puzzles. (Would have worked Much Better if that part of the game flowed more easily. It felt like you were playing two games at once...one puzzle and one adventure)
And that would be great IF the connection between the two would have been smoother.
Overall - I think that it is a Fantastic value for the price and I'd say buy it immediately.
BUT...The Wonderful thing that The Developers have done is given you a DEMO to check out...Do This NOW!
That way you can form your own opinion before purchasing.
I've read people saying things like This is No Portal or Talos Principle and PERHAPS it isn't BUT I'd say that this game is 'right-up-there'.
UPTATE: I'm 40 hours into this game (40 HOURS!) and it's still going....LOVE IT !!!

Non recommandé
16.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 septembre 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

Relicta is a puzzle game that tries to be like The Talos Principle and Portal, but falls flat. The gameplay mechanics, as well as the physics, are a solid and fun experience. However, it falls short due to a weak story, terribly written dialogue, repetitive puzzle design, and various technical issues. If you’re looking for a puzzler that you can easily find exploits in for a speedrun, check this out. But, if you’re looking for a puzzler with replayability, where you have to utilize creative thinking, and the puzzles are all uniquely designed, then look far, far elsewhere.
- Summary from my review [gamingtrend.com] on Gaming Trend

PROS
- Plenty of fun to be found in determining exploits
- Gameplay mechanics and physics are fun


♥♥♥♥
- Repetitive puzzles that do not require creative thinking to complete
- Terribly written dialogue, coupled with a story that drops off in quality by the end
- Artificial difficulty that is only there to waste your time
- Various technical issues

Évaluation publiée le 22 septembre 2020
Nice puzzler akin to talos principle or gravitas. Other than some other reviewers, I enjoyed the story. And I really adore the design of the Labs.
It makes a bit too much usage of invisible walls, and the domes from the inside don't look like domes, which was a bit sad. Also, I got softlocked twice, which sucked, as there are no in-puzzle-save-points and some puzzles can get big.

Didn't quite understand the background lore tho. Why would aegis labs or what they were called build domes in the first place, if all they wanted was ice and the relict?

Recommandé
5.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 juin 2021
It's fine. The main puzzle elements are shooting blocks from one magnetic plate to another and navigating colored gates that are only permissible to certain things (purple you can cross, green blocks can cross, gold nothing can). The first two areas are really nice, I loved some of the momentum puzzles in the second location. In fact, I thought the game was going to end in the ice caves, the last few puzzles were by far the best in the whole game.

Sadly, it's just fine, not great. The game runs out of ideas fast. Later levels are just full of tedious steps. Blocks are hidden on the ceiling, elevators are hidden around corners, switches are wired in confusing ways (this is obviously intentional, and funny at first, but after a while you just want the wires to be clearly placed), etc. Later puzzles are full of extra little steps, just padding to slow you down. If the game was 3 hours long I would have loved every minute.

There is a story, in the technical sense that they included one. It's boring, is not integrated with the game at all, and the dialogue is... strange. Lots of swearing, like a 14 year old boy with something to prove, but coming out of the mouths of 40 year old women. There is some political intrigue stuff which is interesting, but since it's all just spoken into your ear via radio it's more like you are playing a puzzle game while a strange radio drama full of way, way too many F-bombs.

It's a fine puzzle game, and there aren't many of those, so I'm recommending it on that basis alone. But this isn't spectacular.
 
Anhedonia

Non recommandé
47.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 janvier 2021
Pros:
+ Nice visuals
+ Pretty good atmosphere/setting/lore

♥♥♥♥:
- Puzzles don't get more complex, just longer
- Puzzles are extremely repetitive and tedious
- The game is insanely long and dragged out (16 hrs first completion)
- Annoying protagonist with annoying voice acting
- Many puzzles can be broken or partially skipped
- Invisible walls absolutely everywhere around you

Gosh, this was such an insane drag. I really, really wanted to quit Relicta since about halfway through and the only reason I didn't is because I'm just so dead-set on 100%'ing every half-playable game I come across. Honestly, this was borderline masochistic.

The game throws a couple unique puzzle mechanics at you in the beginning and then proceeds to reuse them literal hundreds of times over. The puzzles grow larger and larger later on; they seem complicated at first, but they really aren't. At any given moment you can only do one particular thing to advance the puzzle. Basically you're solving a dozen tiny, isolated, already-done-before, and mostly trivial sub-puzzles to proceed.

The puzzles sucked so much man, it's all just busywork. I constantly wished I could just noclip to the next area and be done with it. The only times you get to actually think creatively is when you break the puzzles and skip entire sections of them. This normally would be pretty cool actually, except the method to break a particular puzzle comes to mind first, and how to solve it the intended way comes to mind much later. Or never at all. That is not good. That's just poor testing.

The game tries so hard to be "like Talos Principle" except the writing is nowhere near as good and there's bloody zero exploration involved. In Talos, you could climb almost everything you see, or bring an item from one puzzle to another via clever tricks. But in Relicta absolutely everything is smeared with invisible walls everywhere, so no exploring for you whatsoever, sir.

Finally, can I have less of this "strong independent Indian woman VS oppressive manipulative men" crap in my videogames please? It's not exactly in-your-face but it was hard to pretend like it's not there. The very thick Indian accent of the protagonist (and several other characters) made it difficult for me to get invested in the story. Call me politically incorrect all you want but English isn't even my native language and the accents still made me chuckle instead of being empathic whenever drama happens. I just couldn't take it too seriously.

Non recommandé
14.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 février 2022
The game looks nice, puzzle elements are fun and challenging, and overworld is well designed.

The story is atrocious, as if written by a neglected toddler. Just bizarre how poorly it was done. Bizarre how a publisher let this go out. The story was all just passive, remote dialogue - no animations or interactions, just pure voice acting. It would have taken such little funding to change it. They could have even made it a silent game without any dialogue and it would actually improve the game.

Such a stark contrast with the attractive design of the world/puzzles.

.....At least until you get about 10 hours in to the game, then the puzzles start to reflect more closely to the story. Almost as if there were quotas for every puzzle to have more and more steps - but no additional challenge. They devolve from fun exploration of gravity/magnetism/ordering, to pure busy work, running extended strings of movement without error. Almost like it changed from a puzzle game to a programming game. There is zero room for creativity in any solution, you have to do it exactly as they intended. They even went back and added a bunch of walls to prevent creative solutions. The programming aspects are tedious - having to go back through a 2 minute sequence because a box clipped a tiny edge is not fun. The puzzles also become much larger towards the end, to the point you have to complete 3-5 full puzzles worth of content before you can get a save point.

They even added a huge number of free DLC maps, almost doubling the game. And those reflect perfectly to the base game. Terrible dialogue that makes me want to play silently, and puzzles that are more of a chore than challenge.

All in all, I'd say there are 5 up-front hours of fun game. Then 10-15 hours of unpleasant, tedious work.

Maybe get it on a deep sale and play til it stops being fun.
 
DoubleDingus
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
50.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 janvier 2022
I completed this game on a different platform.

There are 3 different intros each time you open the game and one of them is a loud raven. Unskippable too. Totally not needed.

Awful dialogue and storytelling, almost makes me not wanna recommend the game. I wish I didn't have to listen to it whatsoever.

Transitioning between levels through the base can leave you often lost in a huge maze as the game only tells you where to go once and provides no additional indicators, so you can end up wasting even up to 5 minutes just to get to the next puzzle tracks set. I just wanna play the game, I don't care about the base especially when there's nothing meaningful on it. The long embarking and lift animations don't add anything good to it either.

Also, you can get stuck. Literally. The game has some ways to prevent it but it's inevitable to eventually occur and then you have to restart. It comes from the player's error but it should not be possible, especially when the game is already so restrictive on what you can do with all the plaster-like blockages such as the invisible barriers and inability to interact with cubes while jumping.

However, the game-play is wonderful if you're just a puzzle enthusiast and this is what makes me recommend this game. The levels get progressively more difficult, challenging and complex, introducing some additional mechanics that sometimes have to be used in unique ways. It's always logical what you have to do when you take it step by step. Doing random things until it works is not an option so it requires you to analyze the levels and think of your options.

The graphics are incredibly wonderful with stunning views, landscapes and a beautiful detailed environment. I was left jaw dropped when I witnessed just how gorgeous this game can look. A screenshot from afar can look like a picture taken in real-life on an expedition. It's very eye-pleasing. But you don't get to see the best of it until a bit later in the game. Each set of puzzles has its own thematic: forest, jungle, canyon, glaciar, etc. so the game doesn't feel repetitive visuals wise.

The sounds effects are satisfying and the environmental noises are really good, especially in the tropical beach levels. Don't know what to say about the soundtrack as I don't have a good musical ear but I wasn't bothered nor dissatisfied by it.

It has a lot of negatives but I just wanted to complete puzzles and this is what I got. If you think the same as me, this is a good game for you.
 
Endeavor ☂

Recommandé
25.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 décembre 2021
Relicta is an interesting first person puzzle game. I personally really liked it. In different domes (themed areas), you have to solve puzzles by using the power of magnets. Same color repels, different color attracts. This simple mechanic never changes and you will have to manipulate cubes and plates to activate switches and open up paths.

The game slowly introduces some additional obstacles over the course of its rather lengthy campaign, though the base mechanics won't change. Including the two content packs that come with the game, it took me 25 hours to beat it which is more than generous for the price. The game looks good, the different areas are varied and the mechanic and the physics attached to it work very well.

There are a few negatives though. Let's address the elephant in the room first: the dialogue is absolutely horrendous. At first, I thought that the characters acting more human by showing weaknesses and swearing a lot would add some spice to the game, but it gets tiring very, very quickly. I am assuming that the dialogue is meant to be funny and lighthearted, but it is completely misplaced and only rarely humorous. The voice actors are top notch though and they did a great job delivering even the most cringeworthy lines.

The story is nothing to write home about - it's okay, really - but hearing a demonic alien voice unironically say "new phone, who this?" made me walk away from my computer and contemplate life for a few minutes. If only I would smoke, I could have completed that dramatic moment as I made my way towards the balcony and gazed into the distance. My wife was like "did I just hear this right"? If I would get a penny for every time a character would say "f***" or "s***" for no reason in this game, I would have enough to fill a pretty big swear jar. Seriously, though, the dialogue is a goldmine for cringe - a word I only use when it is absolutely warranted, so trust me on this. It is honestly oddly endearing, but also really annoying. A weird mix.

The puzzles themselves also have some weaknesses - the biggest one is that they never change and are overall rather easy. New obstacles mix it up here and there, but every single puzzle in this game can be solved by finding the one thing you can do and going from there. They get really big and complex eventually, but even that doesn't matter. It's always: find the start point, go from there. This completely eliminates trial & error - which is a really good thing - but the base mechanics are sadly not varied enough to ever really make the puzzles challenging or elevate them above "mildly difficult at times", and often that is just due to the inherent complexity of some of the levels. I love puzzle games without trial & error, but I almost think Relicta went to far in the opposite direction at times.

Still, though, I definitely recommend Relicta. You can tell that the developers and everyone who contributed put a lot of effort into this. An orchestrated soundtrack, a ton of puzzles - maybe a few too many - and great voice actors make the game worth playing, even if it stretches a bit thin in the last few hours. Just try to take breaks to calm down your annoyance levels at some of the dialogue.
 
Yarusenai
1,137 produits enregistrés

Non recommandé
7.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 avril 2021
Thumbs up/down is really insufficient sometimes and here is such a ~meh~ case.

I am one of the few people that actually kinda liked Magrunner Dark Pulse and this game is basically the exact same mechanics. Yet here the puzzles feel somehow even more fiddly.

Whenever I finish a puzzle I look up what was the intended solution as the way I did it felt like exploiting some kind of bug or unintended solution. And it is not a good sign when most of the time I was correct in that assessment.

Examples: In a cave I skipped half the puzzle because I rode the cube through a small gap in a green field rather than using the spot on the other side of the cave which then afterwards made feel stuck since I couldn't figure out what this part of the level was for. Or I would just jump and drop a cube on a ledge you were supposed to ride a cube to.

Let's talk aesthetics. I feel like the idea to set this game on the moon was an after thought as most enviroments are just forests or caves with not a hint of the moon in sight. Problem is: with all that useless nature surrounding you it makes the puzzles harder to parse. Obvious comparison is Talos Principle but that game had a) cross puzzle secrets and b) was much more visually clear than this game. Worse are the "hands off" puzzles where you have to guide a cube through a maze by changing magnetism. Except you can't see the entire track most of the time and have to do it without seeing where the cube got stuck this time. That the walls are made out wood instead of just something transparent adds to the problem.

There is a sort of Hub in game that let's you go back to old areas but you can't actually enter the puzzles and only go to the entrance if you missed a collectible, thus rendering it useless. It's weird having a completely linear game have a useless hub.

Speaking of the story: You start with an intro cutscene where you don't know what is happening. Then you play everything up to that point but nothing that was important was explained in the mean time. Afterwards you are also on your own again with the other characters basically not mattering anymore, which would be more an issue if all the characters didn't have the same personality anyway. They are all Woman who swears alot which is basically a worse version of Lishari Peghast.

As said the game is not great. But the visuals are nice and some of the puzzles are kinda fun. So if you some one that can put up with a lot of jank then you can try the game for yourself.
 
Metzelmax

Évaluation publiée le 18 octobre 2020
Замечательная игра. Прошел на одном дыхании (потратил 2 дня). Рекомендую.
Сюжета как такового я не особо заметил (быть может меня больше интересовали сами головоломки). Игра отчасти похожа на Q.U.B.E, Portal, .T.E.S.T, The Talos Principle. В каких-то головоломках возникало ощущение их сложностей, однако это иллюзия. Ничего чрезмерно сложного здесь нет. Наоборот, занимательно. Не оторваться.
Хотелось бы продолжения, только вряд-ли, несмотря на намеки в одной из концовок. А сами концовки скомканные.
Еще в игре не хватает жизни. Вы (аватара ГГ) повсюду один (даже в кат.сценах). Нет возможности добавить людей, так пусть будут хотя-бы животные. Кстати, личности персонажей до конца не раскрыты, а некоторых и вовсе как-бы выбросили с диалогов "забыв" про них.
Все же играть стоит. 8/10

Recommandé
146.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 mars 2023
REVISED - Thumbs up after 100 hours of play after rating Thumbs down only a dozen hours in. Stick with it - it gets better. Especially the bonus level Ice Queen - very Portal 2-esque.

Great concept. Combine a Portal or Talos Principle type cube & button puzzle adventure game with magnetism and anti-gravity and weave a story into the reason for having to pass various testing chambers. The early chambers are fairly easy, then applying logic becomes more important, but unfortunately near the end the puzzles start depending on very quick timing, which is very challenging for mobility impaired players and have nothing whatsoever to do with puzzle solving capability. Unfortunate. That said, if you stick with it, you will be rewarded with more challenging puzzles.
I recommend it because I love the genre and applaud efforts by developers to build such games, but be cautioned that the UI is a bit glitchy and the fact that in some of the long puzzles near the end there is no intermediate save functionality (meaning you have to completely restart a long level if you have to quit before completing the whole level - which compounds the whole dexterity/speed issue).
 
navycommander

3.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 septembre 2022
A puzzle game that gets ruined by hidden mechanics and terrible writing...

The game itself isn't too bad if you just think about the puzzles itself. The only main thing is that you have to walk around to find every corner of each difficult puzzle to see if you've missed a cube or teleporter.

The worst part is the writing. The characters act weird ALL the time. The boss is always screaming at everyone, but then 2 minutes later can have a "normal" conversation with the same person she screamed at..
The main character for some reason sings a line about "going to the moon" which the the AI called Sys(short for System...) interrupts her to say "but we're already on the moon". Such a usefull conversation, not at all forcefully written to say "AI are robots who doesn't understand human behavior"...

2/10 - Couldn't even finish the game because of the terrible writing and annoying puzzle mechanics that are for luck only.
 
Phsymon
1,286 produits enregistrés
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
29.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 aout 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

Relicta is another superb entry in the first person puzzle genre. It follows a format reminiscent of Portal 2, mixing puzzle areas and narrative storytelling, though with a hub area layout more similar to The Talos Principle. I personally enjoyed the sci-fi story and and appreciated the really solid voicework that goes along with it.

Gameplay mostly revolves around manipulating blocks and pressing switches using magnetic charges and being able to toggle gravity on said blocks. Various types of forcefields also need to be worked around, and a few other mechanics are added later. I found the vast majority of the puzzles to be intuitive, even the later puzzles which get rather long. There were a few instances in the final chapters of the game however where I found some puzzle steps overly fiddly since they rely too much on free form physics simulation.

Relicta is a very good-looking game with beautifully-designed environments and utilizing the high quality presentation of Unreal Engine. It runs very well too, staying locked at 120 fps the vast majority of the time on my GTX 1070 and scales down really well to even older mid-range hardware. The only fault I can find is the "dirt" overlay on the camera that can really get in the way of appreciating the game's visuals in certain lighting conditions. I'm sure it's supposed to simulate the character's helmet, but I can't imagine anyone would wear such a dirty visor without cleaning it.

So overall, I highly recommend this game. I can't get enough of good first person puzzle games and it's nice to play a higher quality production again since they don't come around very often.

Edit: Two free DLCs were released for the game (accessed from Extras on the main menu,) containing about 12 lengthy and difficult puzzles each along with new story dialogue. I was very impressed with the quantity and quality of this content, particularly since it's free. But while the puzzles are good, there are some issues. It's very easy to block progress in many of the puzzles and force you to reset - which can be a large setback due to how long many of them are. I also ran into some issues with overly complicated physics movements not being reliable. Overall though, a very satisfying addition to the game.
 
Soüp
2,219 produits enregistrés

Recommandé
29.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 janvier 2022
Nie jestem fanem gier logicznych, zobaczyłem poradnik, że trwa 3 godziny i 26 minut, a że tanie i krótkie gry to dla mnie plus to kupiłem.
Tyle że realnie wszystko zajęło jakieś 8 razy dłużej niż ten poradnik. Aż tak wciągnęło.
Relicta bazuje na klockach które można naładować na czerwono lub niebiesko, oraz dodać/odjąć grawitację. To samo można zrobić z wieloma elementami gry, także i ruchomymi, by odpychać klocki lub je przyciągać, a po wyłączeniu grawitacji stojąc na nich na nich fruwać. Klocki, pieczołowicie ustawiane w odpowiednich miejscach odblokowują nam drogę dalej, lub też np. zmieniają barierę z "tylko dla klocków" na "tylko dla gracza". Jedno muszę przyznać co w tej grze jest genialne - ma świetne łamigłówki oraz doskonale się rozkręca. Przez zdecydowaną większość gry jak dla mnie lepsza niż Portal 1 czy 2 jeśli chodzi o same zagadki. Twórcy wykorzystują wraz z upływem czasu coraz to mniej oczywiste rozwiązania (jak ruchoma platforma z możliwością naładowania jej od spodu co łatwo przegapić, serię grawitacyjnych punktów tworzących tor da klocka by dotarł do celu), a także dochodzą nowe elementy gry. To co ważne - nie ma tu ani większego szoku, ani przesadnej powtarzalności. Gra jest jednak trudna i to tak na serio.
Choć większość zagadek ma jedno rozwiązanie to jednak wcale tak nie mało można trafić na więcej, a nawet (choć już bardzo rzadko) pójść na skróty. Po przejściu zawsze sprawdzałem "co na to solucja" i nie raz byłem zadowolony że wynalazłem coś ciekawszego.
Mały plus za całkiem fajną opowiastkę oraz grafikę. Niby nie było to jakoś potrzebne, ale zawsze pozytywnie wpływa to na odbiór. minus za bazę do której wracamy - brzydka, powtarzalna, a te znajdźki w niej u mnie nie zaplusowały, bo takie na siłę. Czasem też wszystko trwało zbyt długo, chyba szkoda że twórcy nie zaimplementowali cofania czasu. W trudnych grach łażenie w tę i we w tę obniża satysfakcję z gry, wołałbym spędzać jak najmniej czasu na łażeniu a jak najwięcej na myśleniu.
Przez większość gry wahałem się z oceną gry i tak 8,5 wydało mi się w sam raz, pomimo wszelakich pomimo. Niestety obniżam o 1 punkt za ostatni etap (każdy składa się z kilku map). W nim gra przerosła twórców i kilka razy musiałem restartować mapkę bo nie było już żadnego powrotu, coś co nie zdarzyło mi się ani razu wcześniej, tylko podczas ostatniego etapu. W efekcie był on po prostu frustrujący i zamiast dobrego humoru pozostał mały niesmak.
Ocena 7,5/10. Byłoby o punkt więcej, gdyby nie ostatni etap, to naprawdę świetna gra.
 
BlackHole
1,204 produits enregistrés
0
10 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
1.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 aout 2020
Если вы любитель головоломок, игнорирующий все другие составляющие игры, то, возможно, Relicta для вас может быть неплохим приобретением: средней сложности с тяготением к сложным испытания вам могут прийтись по вкусу, несмотря на ощущающуюся однотипность.
Всё остальное не восхищает. Картинка ничем не в техническом плане не примечательна. Модели в большинстве своём простенькие. Физика настолько реалистичная, что некоторые препятствия можно преодолеть на плавно дрейфующем по воздуху кубике, не сумевшем остановиться в задуманном создателями месте. Уровни созданы с активным применением невидимых стен-полей. Диалоги — это просто финиш — то ли перепалки двух девок на районе, то ли аутентичное общение в каком-нибудь провинциальном отделе прикладной разработки транснационального ИТ гиганта, ну хоть на том спасибо, что членами друг друга не обкладывают. Фабула, во всяком случае первой части игры, написана для галочки, хотя пролог обещает некоторое драматическое развитие и, предполагаю, неожиданные повороты.
 
quixoticaxis
4,108 produits enregistrés
1
13 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
21.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 aout 2020
Узнав, что разработкой игры занимается всего несколько человек я был приятно удивлен! Каждый раз меня радует, что годноту может делать горстка людей, а гов..ноту смело позволяет себе делать даже большая и жадная компания.
Соблазнил безусловно ценник (около 500р) и реклама игры как идейного продолжателя небезызвестного Portal. Поиграв несколько часов я понял, что в этой игре-головомке есть в принципе все что нужно. Тут есть: сложные задачи, приятная картинка, футуристическое будущее, добротная озвучка и даже сюжет. Конечно же упор Relicta сделан прежде всего на решение головоломок после решения которых чувствуется приятное ощущение в роде :"хмм а я не такой безнадежный!".
Смело могу порекомендовать Relicta для прохождения тем людям, которые не ищут от игры легких путей, любят напрячь свой мозг и решать головоломки!
UPD спустя почти 20 часов.
Головоломки великолепны, если не обращать внимание на сюжет, который к сожалению без персонажей просто натянут, то игра хороша. Хочешь попытать мозг, воображение, внимательность и задницу на возгорание - игра идеально для этого подходит. Что касается сюжета - затянут самими головоломками.

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLHEwVYzdW_bresl9fwuvkwE_5F_aUHJy1

the_big_mikey
331 produits enregistrés
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
26.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 avril 2021
Реликта начинается в СМИ. Вы находитесь в гравитационных перчатках физика по имени Анжелика Патель, когда она пытается справиться с кризисом. Титульный экземпляр вызывает опасные аномалии на терраформированной лунной базе Чандра, где она и ее коллеги проводят все свои исследования. Она врывается в камеру, в которой он находится, с намерением все выключить. Но, прежде чем она успела это сделать, он раскрывается, обвивает щупальце ее запястье и тянет ее в трещину.

Затем игра переносится на годы назад к более раннему тренировочному упражнению, в котором Энджи участвовала в лесном биоме Чандры. Оттуда прорисовываются детали, и вы лучше понимаете, кто все такие и что с ними происходит. Как и в большинстве головоломок от первого лица, вы будете тратить время на решение головоломок в одиночестве. Но Энджи часто общается с другими людьми, которые в основном состоят из ее дочери студенческого возраста Киры и ее коллеги по работе Лайи. Да и ИИ системы, которого она называет «Сис»

Как и в Portal , головоломки в Relicta происходят в камерах тестирования. Только здесь они все в разных биомах. Лес, тундра, скалистый каньон, прекрасный пляж – каждая среда по-своему впечатляет. Вам нужно выяснить, как установить ящик на различные переключатели, чтобы открыть путь вперед.

Энджи носит пару перчаток для управления гравитацией, одна из которых синяя, а другая красная. Они работают так же, как и два цвета порталов, ну, вы знаете, но особенности совершенно разные. Все поля, с которыми вы сталкиваетесь, по умолчанию серые, и вы можете изменить их цвет в любое время, а также включить их функцию антигравитации, которая позволяет им легко перемещаться под действием любой силы гравитации, действующей на них.

Чтобы успешно решить множество головоломок Relicta , вам нужно использовать эти панели и другие подобные устройства, чтобы перемещать ящики, куда они должны пойти.

Проще говоря, Relicta – это отдельный класс. Его дизайн часто на голову превосходит многих своих современников, текст высочайшего качества, а игра выглядит намного лучше, чем это действительно нужно. Абсолютно каждый, кто считает себя фанатом этого жанра, обязан играть в эту игру. Это перенесет вас на Луну. И другой мир где вы еще не были .
 
꧁ƉɆMØ₦꧂

Non recommandé
4.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 janvier 2022
Relicta is a Portal Clone. I love Portal Clones. But not like this...
Firstly I don't know why but whenever an indie or even AA studio gets their hands on the Unreal engine they manage to make it hog way more performance than it's worth. This is another example of that, just bad frames over heating my computer for no reason.
The assets and voice lines are super high quality. The story is a drag for the first 3 hours but the intrigue hits after shoemaker which makes you want to continue. The gameplay.... it's nothing we haven't seen before.

I've played every Portal Clone under the sun and this is just the least fun I've had solving puzzles in a test chamber. The game just removes all the usual toys from you. The Y rotation of every cube is permanently locked, there's invisible walls everywhere, you can't let go of boxes in midair, the physics is just tame, quickly picking up up boxes while running is just not a thing, and this game features one of the most unsatisfying jump arcs ever. It's more of a *Huughh!* than a jump.
There's also so many fudgable solutions that sometimes make me wonder if I just cheesed something... which I prbly did at least twice...

I do plan on completing the game but I can only take a little of it at a time.
 
Broockle

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
1.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 juin 2021
I have to give it a hard "Meh." It has interesting puzzle gameplay, but the plot is boring and dull. The environments look pretty, but they're too complex for the gameplay; and make it hard to know what you're supposed to be doing. I spent about 10 minutes trying to solve a puzzle incorrectly because the admittedly very pretty level design made me think there was a completely different answer.

Also, the soundtrack is uninspired. This is a game where you're supposed to stand around, think, and solve logic puzzles. You don't want an overpowering or distracting soundtrack, but you want something to help you not stress about the puzzles so much.

If you enjoy puzzle games like the Witness, or Myst, with very little active plot and just puzzles presented to the player, I recommend the game.

Évaluation publiée le 25 septembre 2021
It is a great title, but I progressively became bored and frustrated. Showing interest in other titles in my collection and those on sale.

Deadcore, Impulsion, Desync, Neon Boost, SEUM Speed Runners from Hell were thoroughly enjoyable. But certainly Kovaak's Aim Trainer (every week), is my main (puzzle) skill test game that I have enjoyed and prefer.

I did use youtube QUITE a few times for Relicta, as with my interest becoming lost. I just couldn't figure things out and enjoy it all the way through as much as I was doing from the start. Memorising what you can and can't do, It isn't as simple as say Portal 1 & 2. Also I'm finding this genre tends to get more annoying than entertaining lol.

The story dialog helped feed me, the audio, graphics and game play are all very good, but I still wanted to player other games, like Quake Champions more so... we can't help what we like most can we.

Combat sections (50% complete at time of review) if yet to come? would help break up, having my brain tested and feeling stupid.

:) 8/10 - I will complete this, but in very spaced out sessions, likely over the course of 2021/22.
 
Ind

7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
4.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 novembre 2020
The attempt towards making a portal-esque puzzle game is respectable, but the game is very flawed. For starters, some of the puzzles(even at the later stages) make no sense at all from a logical standpoint. The puzzles revolve around gravitational mechanisms but maintain no consistency in how the cubes move or function. Secondly, the story and the dialogues are pretty boring and lame in my opinion, and I can't seem to enjoy any of the characters or their dialogues. I have no interest in finishing the game with such mediocre and inconsistent puzzles and a boring story who's only positive attribute can be the space and sci-fi setting, which can at least be said to be respectable. But the part that really made me dislike this game are the jumping mechanics. It is EXTREMELY frustrating to jump in this game as the player jumps way too low and requires multiple attempts just to get over a ledge. Parts where you're elevated from the ground and have to jump over a tiny ledge can be frustrating when you keep falling off and pretty much have to repeat the puzzle over again. This one tiny flaw really put the nail in the coffin for this game, and makes it borderline unplayable. Decent graphics and atmosphere mean nothing when the mechanics are so poorly made. I love puzzle games such as The Talos Principle, The Witness and Portal and each have their own amazing traits that make them unique amongst each other which elevates them into the pantheon of great puzzle games. But this game is far far inferior to even the average ones such as The Turing Test. I would not recommend this game unless you've played every other puzzle game out there and are obsessed with the genre like I am. But even I couldn't really get into this game. 4/10 at best.
 
zero
195 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
27.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 septembre 2020
Relicta is a flawed masterpiece. The puzzles are challenging and clever and had me hooked all the way through. The game should appeal to anyone who likes the "test chamber" genre (Portal, Talos Principle, Turing Test, Q.U.B.E.). A fairly simple cube mechanic is steadily built upon incrementally and there never seemed like there was an unfair learning curve. Huge congratulations to the puzzle designers as the game is also quite long and each puzzle area has a unique take on the mechanics.

The graphics and environments are also stunning, even running on 4-5 year old PC on low graphics.

The storyline is pretty silly as a loose way of linking test chambers but is at least a partial driving force to hold the whole thing together. One thing that baffled me is the dialogue has a huge amount of swearing. It doesn't bother me so much, but I feel the developers could easily have removed this (or had some way to censor it - there isn't) to make the game fun for all age groups.

Enjoyed from start to finish, and look forward to more from the developers.
 
biscram

1,003 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
18.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 octobre 2023
ブロックに磁力を与えることが出来るグローブを使い、極性を変化させながら引力と斥力を使ってスイッチを操作する一人称パズルゲーム。基本的に出来ることは赤と青の磁石の極性を変化させることのみで単純だが、それらの組み合わせと応用による操作パターンは多く、パズルとして考えることはそれなりに複雑。しかし、それでありながら物理的・直感的なイメージから外れず、「こうすればこうなるだろう」と考えて準備した通りの挙動を見事にトレースしてくれるのは気持ち良く、パズルゲームとしてのデキの良さが伺える。

難易度は序盤からやや高め。磁力によりブロックを反発させる際の挙動や力の掛かり方を学ぶいわゆるチュートリアルに近いステージだが、ゲーム内では現実よりもパズルとしての規則性を優先するためか、磁石の反発力を使う場合に若干コツというか特別な理解が必要になる。しかし丁寧に教えてくれるわけでもなく、試して覚えるしか無いのでここが辛いところ。ここでコツさえ掴んでしまえばその後はゲーム進捗による難易度の上昇率はゆるやかで、少し悩むところもあれば妙に簡単なステージもごちゃ混ぜで現れてくる。なので序盤の難易度に驚いてやめてしまうのは勿体ないので、なんとかコツを探り当てて切り抜けてほしい。それが出来ればその後は気持ちよくパズルを楽しめる。

欠点といえば、先に書いたような序盤の優しさのない難易度と妙にダラダラ喋り続けるわりに理解しづらいストーリーくらいか（会話はスキップできるが）。広いステージでも細かくプレイ可能なエリアが区切られているので、どこから手を付けて良いのか分からずパズル以外のところで悩むなんてことはなく、段階的に進捗を感じられるように作られているのはユーザーに優しい。パズルの質は高く、考え方に無理はなく、操作性も良い。またボリュームも十分で、一人称パズル好きの私があまり詰まること無く体感でスイスイ解き進めてもクリアまで12時間以上遊べるくらいにはある。おすすめ。
 
cHeeSy
1,111 produits enregistrés
0

1
Recommandé
